user_profile: M enjoys relaxed, casual dining with authentic Mediterranean flavors, especially Lebanese cuisine that offers generous portions and a full‑bar atmosphere. He prefers venues that are easygoing yet attentive, with friendly, personable staff and prompt, reliable service; delays or unresponsive administration are poorly tolerated. The ideal setting is a casual, unpretentious environment that provides outdoor seating, take‑out or delivery options, and accepts reservations for groups, with a mid‑range price point that delivers good value. Practical conveniences such as available parking and a straightforward ordering process matter, while he is not looking for upscale, noisy sports‑bar or child‑centric spaces. Overall, M is discerning and expects competent, courteous service and consistent quality without excessive formality.

chosen.business_profile: Parkallen Restaurant in Edmonton, AB offers a hybrid menu of Mediterranean‑style pizza, Italian dishes and a growing focus on steak‑based entrees, with only limited traditional Middle Eastern options remaining. The venue is casual‑attire, average‑noise and features a full bar, outdoor tables and bike‑friendly street parking; reservations are accepted and both delivery and takeout are available, though Wi‑Fi is not provided. Price level is moderate‑high (≈$$$) and portions are modest relative to the cost. It accommodates large parties and groups well, but is not geared toward children and has no dedicated kid‑friendly amenities. Service is generally attentive, though occasional oversights on special‑diet requests have been reported. Overall the setting is relaxed, with a decent wine list and a full bar, making it suitable for dinner gatherings in a casual atmosphere.

chosen.review_text:
Tonight I visited the west end location. It was such a great experience from start to finish. The atmosphere is relaxing, the staff was very pleasant and personable and the very generous food portions, delicious! If you are looking for authentic Lebanese cuisine give them a try by dining in or order via skip the dishes.

I wished that I took a photo of my plate to share.. guess this is my excuse to go back ;)

rejected.review_text:
After putting up my review I was contacted by an Amre representative. My concerns were to be forwarded the Customer Care Manager as well as the Western Regional Manager and after reviewing my concerns I was to be contacted. I was hopeful we would get this all resolved but unfortunately I was mistaken. To date, I have NOT been contacted by either of the above Managers, the refund has yet to be processed and to top it off... another black control panel was delivered to my home. So as it stands I still am being ignored, I have a mismatched oven, I have an extra control panel in the wrong color and a $343.43 posted charge on my credit card for a part that was returned. 

Why is this so complicated?? It makes no sense to me ‍

user_profile: Jessica is a relaxed, family‑oriented diner who enjoys exploring a variety of tasty, hearty fare in casual, kid‑friendly settings. She favors American comfort foods such as lobster rolls, seafood, fried shrimp and clams, as well as Southern soul‑food staples like chicken & waffles, collard greens, yams and mac & cheese, and she also appreciates Japanese hibachi dishes, sushi and Mexican‑Indian frybread offerings. Her ideal ambience is laid‑back and lively enough for a family outing – outdoor seating with a view, easy parking (including lots and bike spaces), wheelchair accessibility, free Wi‑Fi, and a casual dress code are important, while she doesn’t seek upscale or overly noisy environments. She expects friendly, attentive service that delivers generous portions with good value; speed is appreciated but not at the expense of food quality. Mid‑range price points with clear portion value appeal to her, and she likes venues that provide takeout, delivery, and the option to reserve without strict requirements. Overall, Jessica is easygoing and forgiving, focusing more on pleasant experiences, family suitability, and solid food value than on perfection.

chosen.review_text: Closed down? I can't even believe it. It's only been two months since I was there, but I've been dreaming about it. The frybread with green chile was absolutely delicious, the best I've ever had. It was a giant portion, too. I hope the owners can bring it back. It was awesome!

rejected.review_text:
We got the smothered chicken, oxtails, yams, collard greens, mac n cheese, mashed potatoes, and a waffle. Everything was very flavorful. I preferred the oxtails, while my daughter preferred the chicken. The chicken was a boneless breast that was cooked nice and tender. My favorite sides were the greens and yams. The mac n cheese was creamy and had a good amount of pepper. The star was the waffle. It was heavy, filling, and delicious. 

For some reason, even though I ate a lot, it didn't leave me feeling weighed down from grease. I would definitely eat there again.

chosen.review_text:
I've been there twice now, once with a few friends and once on a date, and both times the experience blew me away.  On my first trip, we tallied 16 different types of animal (from scallops to boar to escargot) that we ate!  If I'm to be extremely critical, I thought there was too much BBQ on the mini tacos, but everything else was amazing.  The specialty cocktails are unique and delicious, and for the small beer list, they balance it out so there's something for everyone.  

My second trip was with a Pescetarianism (vegetarian who eats seafood), so I ended up eating a bunch of things I normally wouldn't order, but was pleasantly surprised as to how delicious a meal can be without loads of meat.  As simple as the Roasted Butternut Squash was, it was really tasty.  

I can't imagine what kind of training the servers must go through to be so knowledgeable about their menu, but I'm very appreciative of how helpful they are.  Service was perfect both times.  I'll be back for sure.

For those who left 1 or 2-star reviews, you're either cheap, don't know good food, or don't understand how restaurants work; ie, its a small, awesome place, just make a reservation!

rejected.review_text:
I almost feel bad about giving 3 stars, as I'm sure they're worth 4 or 5 stars on many occasions, just not when I was there.  I walked in with a buddy at dinner time on a Friday night with no reservation; I know, that's my fault, but I was happy to sit at the bar.  With two bartenders and a bar back, I don't think we should have waited as long as we did at each step: ordering drinks, ordering food, and paying the bill.  

PROS:  Tuna Tartar and Goat Cheese Bruschetta were aweseome.
             My friend's Crabcake entree was delicous.

CONS:  If I'm not drinking beer, and I didn't because of the lack of good beer, I order a Manhatten.  I really hate when they're shaken, as it waters down the drink and leaves ice chips on the top.
             My Seared Tuna entree wasn't good.  I dunno if it was a cute from a huge tuna, or what causes a tough, stringy, fibrous skin between each segment of the fish, but it made it very unappealing.  The worst part was that I was about to order the Scallops, but the bartender enthusiastically told me that the Tuna was the best thing on the menu.  Its hard to mess up seared tuna unless its over cooked or a bad cut, and I think I just got a bad cut.  

I'll possibly give them another chance because I see great potention, and its so big and busy that I understand there will be longer waits on occasion.

rejected.review_text: Appallingly bad service in this airport gate hotel. Five employees were staring at me from the kitchen for minutes before one came out to help me. I was the only customer in the restaurant. The grilled cheese contained partially melted Kraft American cheese on a hard roll. I couldn't eat it and demanded a refund. Don't wait to eat at the gate and have to settle for this poor excuse for food.

user_profile: Lisa is a detail‑oriented, budget‑conscious diner who favors casual, family‑friendly spots where food is reliably prepared and the environment is spotless. chosen.review_text:
I have wanted to try this restaurant since I heard Jack Harris of 970 WFLA talking on the radio about how much he and his wife loved the food and atmosphere. My family stopped in this past Sunday for a late lunch after Baccalaureate mass & Graduation ceremonies. This restaurant has a fun atmosphere, tastefully decorated and trendy . It was drizzling outside but there were lots of young families walking around the area . We were seated immediately inside. Unfortunately the restaurant was full of flies that were pretty bothersome throughout our lunch  - probably because of the rain . 
We had :
gator fritters/ ok 
Calamari / didn't try 
To start .
My daughter had a burger/  Which she said was so so 
My Husband had the Gouda grouper and he said it was good but we did some trading and I didn't care for the flavor despite loving grouper and Gouda cheese. 
I had the shrimp and grits, which had a interesting presentation, the grits were triangular shaped patties and the 5 shrimp were nice sized but they were not clean ! It would have taken just a few extra seconds to rinse the poop vein off the shrimp. I also got two separate mouth fulls of shrimp shells which I think they probably used to flavor the butter mixture and were supposed to be removed before serving but weren't. The green beans were inedible like they were cooked in a broiler. This meal was a total letdown! 
This restaurant is really beautiful but they need to improve their food game - it's all in the details!
We spent $120.ish for 3 ppl on the lunch menu - Tampa has a bunch of terrific restaurants to choose from at this price point. 
Too Funny - after I decided I couldn't eat it my husband pointed out the greasy little hair on my bottom plate which I did take a picture of but will spare you from but if the manager would like to see , I'll show him . Fare Thee Well - Ulele ~

chosen.review_text:
I took my husband into the ER at midnight with chest pains. The nurses took him in right away and the staff began running all tests needed. I was not allowed into the ER with him due to new COVID "visiting" hours but the nurse personally called me and let me know what my husband status was. My hubby left his phone in the car during all the commotion and another nurse was kind enough to bring it back to him so that we could stay in contact. He also does not have health insurance and he let them know. The Dr was thorough and the staff was so kind and helpful. We recently received the bill and they discounted a great portion of the bill and we are more than happy to pay all of it. Hopefully, that was the whole thing and there aren't any other bills still being processed for delivery lol 

The only thing that I thought was questionable was that they did not test him for COVID, however, he did not have any COVID symptoms and all other test results were coming in negative so the Doc felt it was unnecessary. 

I can say today, now two weeks later, that he does not have COVID.

The food matched the service - awful. 

Server was slamming dishes and seemed completely and utterly miserable. 

Ordered a Cesar, which was ok, and a basil fettuccine in some soup of a lemon sauce. The pasta was over cooked, the sausage was not good, the dish was swimming in liquid, pulled out lemon rinds from the bottom of the bowl, the chicken was over cooked and there was no noticeable basil in the dish. 

Overpriced to boot!

You're better off eating at the beef o'Brady's on property.

user_profile: Leslie enjoys casual yet character‑rich eateries where good food is paired with a relaxed, family‑friendly atmosphere. She favors American comfort and New‑American dishes, hearty brunch plates, and occasional Italian fare, preferring menus that offer both vegetarian and meat options and generous portions at moderate prices. Ideal spots are those with a modestly lively or quiet vibe, outdoor seating, easy parking, and the ability to make reservations or accommodate groups, often with a full bar and free Wi‑Fi. She values clear pricing and prompt, attentive service; long delays, confusing extra charges, or uncomfortable, overly communal seating make her dissatisfied. Practical amenities such as bike or street parking, kid‑friendly facilities, and pet‑welcome policies are a plus. rejected.review_text: I went with a group of 5 today for the Drag Diva Brunch. The show started at 1:30, so we got there at 1:10.  We were told to sit at the bar, because they didn't start seating until 1:30. We had made reservations for which we had to pay $5.50 each (reservations were recommended on the site) and it was implied that we were getting a deal, but it reality we paid an extra $0.50 over the $29.95 fixed price for the show/meal. We wouldn't have minded paying an extra 50 cents to insure a seat if that had been clear on the website. They gave us water right away, then took our drink orders. We finally got our drinks 25 minutes later, right as the show was starting. Other tables already had their meals by then. We got to smell their yummy food smells while our stomaches rumbled for another hour and 10 minutes. Once the fabulous show was over, they finally brought our our meals. The food was good - no complaints there, but to wait over 1 1/2 hours to eat after being seated was awful. To sum it up, the show was raunchy and fun, the food was fine, but the service was lacking.

user_profile: Laura is a practical, convenience‑driven diner who favors laid‑back American breakfast and brunch spots that serve solid coffee and simple fare such as sandwiches and salads. She prefers casual, relaxed atmospheres—often with outdoor seating and free Wi‑Fi—where the menu is easy to see before ordering and service moves quickly without long waits. Cleanliness, readily available water, and friendly, competent staff are important to her, and she appreciates clear pricing that won’t strain a tight lunch‑break budget. She values venues that offer convenient parking or easy take‑out options and is willing to give a place another chance if minor service hiccups are acknowledged (e.g., a gift card), but she is quick to note disorganization or slow service as a drawback.

chosen.business_profile: Belle Starr Salon in Tucson offers a boutique hair‑care experience that doubles as a small art venue and event space, blending hair styling, beauty services, and community arts. The stylist team specializes in curly‑hair cuts, coloring, perms and straight‑perm services, and also serves kids, making it family‑friendly. Appointments are required and can be booked online; the salon accepts credit cards and provides free Wi‑Fi. Accessible via street and lot parking plus bike racks, the location is wheelchair‑accessible. Inside, a “Keep Tucson Pretty” mural, a comfortable lounge with a record player, and complimentary soda water create a relaxed, community‑oriented atmosphere, and the space regularly hosts concerts, art shows and yoga sessions. Prices are competitive for the market, and the emphasis on local culture and personalized service adds value, though the lack of a garage or valet limits premium parking options.

chosen.review_text:
I needed an urgent hair appointment after a disappointing highlight treatment by a different salon. The owner of Belle Starr was very prompt and offered me a timely appointment. She was able to work with my hair to come up with a short term fix and I left happy! 
Gratuities are included in the price which was a first for me! I thought it was very reasonably priced and booked another appointment

rejected.business_profile: LeBuzz Caffe – Tucson, AZ – a bright, modern café focused on breakfast and brunch with a menu that also includes salads, sandwiches, and a robust coffee‑and‑tea selection. Prices are reasonable, offering good value for freshly baked pastries, breads and all‑day breakfast dishes. The space features ample indoor seating plus a spacious back patio for outdoor dining, and free Wi‑Fi is available (though the signal can be spotty). Service is attentive, friendly and professionally managed, and the venue maintains a clean, well‑kept atmosphere with music set at a comfortable level. Customers can take advantage of a convenient on‑site parking lot and take‑out service; there is no valet or garage parking. The café’s layout supports both solo visits and groups, and the modern vibe avoids an overly “hipster” feel. A minor drawback is the occasional inconsistency of the Wi‑Fi performance.

rejected.review_text:
Oh LeBuzz...
I love the Tanque Verde location. Never had a problem, great food and coffee. 
When they opened this location I was nervous for my wallet because I figured I'd be spending all my lunch breaks here since I work so close. 

First time we went - friendly young staff but unfortunately they gave our food to another table. We waited an hour for one sandwich. We were given a gift card for the wait which I appreciate. 

Second visit - no redeeming qualities this time. I waited about 25 minutes for my coffee and saw how flustered staff was. The (?)owner is a nice man but he kept having to show the workers how to do their jobs. And this is months into opening. 

My biggest complaint? No menus until you get to the counter!! Doesn't make sense to me. I had to wait 15 minutes in line just to get a menu so I could leave the line again to review the menu. 
Please put menus in a more accessible area!

Plus there's no water available at the soda station. I saw multiple confused people take a pitcher thinking it was water but were disappointed when it was some type of juice/lemonade?

user_profile: Samantha is a practical, no‑nonsense diner who values convenience, helpful staff, and straightforward service. She gravitates toward casual, grocery‑style food venues offering familiar American fare such as fresh seafood, cheese, and a broad selection of everyday grocery items rather than upscale or specialty cuisines. She prefers a low‑key, family‑friendly atmosphere where the environment is quiet enough for a quick shop and not dominated by aggressive upselling (e.g., persistent wine and beer promotions). Efficient, friendly service and short wait times are important to her; she is especially frustrated by long checkout lines and any perception of staff being inattentive. Her price expectations are modest, leaning toward budget‑friendly to low‑midrange options, and she appreciates good value over premium pricing. Practical considerations such as ample lot parking, bike parking where available, and extended or 24‑hour hours are strong pluses, as is the ability to take items to go. Overall, she is moderately critical—quick to note service lapses or high prices—but remains appreciative of places that improve their layout, staff helpfulness, and overall convenience.

chosen.business_profile: Giant Food Stores in Malvern, PA is a low‑price grocery market that also provides ready‑to‑eat items for takeout and delivery; it offers a broad selection of everyday staples and generally helpful staff, though the interior shows signs of aging and can feel cluttered or less tidy. Prices sit at the budget end of the scale (price range 1) and credit cards are accepted. Parking is limited to on‑street options, with no garage, lot, or valet service available. The venue is best suited for quick stops or picking up prepared food, but the overall ambience is modest and may not meet expectations for a polished shopping environment.

rejected.review_text: I just wanted to do some regular shopping, but was bombarded by employees who kept pointing at the beer and wine section.  Even the cashier pointed out that this beer was on sale and that wine is excellent.  I told the manager that it's not right to bombard customers with this type of stuff because some people don't drink.  They are also way too expensive. Give me a Giant anyday.

chosen.review_text:
Excellent Gluten Free bakery/cafe!!!
Lots of choices for baked goods. If you get something from the case, let it come to room temperature before you consume it and you'll be blown away! Items outside the case are also very good. We had a glazed donut and a churro. The donut was good and the churro was phenomenal!!! They make THE BEST brownies by far so don't miss those. We also got a chocolate cupcake with espresso icing and chocolate covered espresso on top. Once that got to room temp, it was one of the best GF cupcakes in town!
We also grabbed a couple brunch/lunch food items: avocado basket which my partner loved and ham and cheese with dairy free provolone swapped for the Swiss - also great!
We will certainly be back as the avocado basket is now my partner's fave breakfast in town. 
It's easy to miss the location in a strip mall on Willmot near Pima. It's next to the UPS store and the CBD store.

rejected.business_profile: Luckie's Thai-Asian Cuisine in Tucson, AZ serves a mixed Thai‑Chinese menu in a casual, average‑noise setting that is family‑ and group‑friendly, with good kids’ accommodations and a TV for background entertainment. The restaurant is priced at a moderate level (price range 2) and is open for lunch and dinner; it does not take reservations and offers counter style service rather than full table service. Credit cards are accepted, takeout is available, but there is no delivery, Wi‑Fi, or outdoor seating. Parking is limited to street and bike options, with no valet or dedicated lot, and dogs are not allowed. Staff are described as helpful and organized for to‑go orders, though some Thai dishes may be prepared with a heavier soy‑sauce profile that can feel overly salty for purist Thai fans. Overall, Luckie's provides a convenient, affordable spot for casual Asian fare, especially appealing for groups and families looking for quick lunch or dinner in a strip‑mall location.

This area is a bit lackluster when it comes to good Asian food. This location offers MANY choices with a full complement of Chinese and Thai dishes to choose from. The menu is basically the greatest hits for most American palates. We generally go for the yellow curry and pad see ew which are both good here. The store seems to be doing a lot of to go orders and keeps them organized by telephone number.  
The staff are helpful and will talk you through the dishes if needed. The location is in the strip mall of the frys parking lot.

user_profile: Kristina is a relaxed, family‑oriented diner who values solid, well‑executed comfort foods over fancy gimmicks. She gravitates toward classic American pizza, hearty Mexican fare, and authentic Italian dishes, appreciating generous portions, a wide variety of toppings or sauces, and reliably cooked meals (no soggy crusts or under‑done items). Her favorite spots are casual, low‑key venues that are kid‑friendly and suitable for groups, with average noise levels and a laid‑back atmosphere rather than upscale or romantic settings. She expects friendly, attentive service and becomes dissatisfied when staff are rude or slow, but she tolerates modest imperfections if the food and value are strong. Price‑wise she prefers mid‑range menus (around a $‑$$ level) that offer good value and portion size, and she often takes advantage of delivery or take‑out options. Practical conveniences such as easy street parking, bike parking, and the ability to order without a reservation are important, while she does not prioritize Wi‑Fi, outdoor seating, or a full bar. Overall, Kristina is appreciative of straightforward, well‑run eateries and is quick to note poor service but otherwise easygoing when the core dining experience meets her expectations.

Price‑wise she prefers mid‑range menus (around a $‑$$ level) that offer good value and portion size, and she often takes advantage of delivery or take‑out options. Practical conveniences such as easy street parking, bike parking, and the ability to order without a reservation are important, while she does not prioritize Wi‑Fi, outdoor seating, or a full bar. Overall, Kristina is appreciative of straightforward, well‑run eateries and is quick to note poor service but otherwise easygoing when the core dining experience meets her expectations.

Yianni's Cafe and Grill is a casual Greek‑seafood spot in Tarpon Springs offering a full bar, outdoor seating, and bike parking, with a modest $‑$$ price point and a happy‑hour menu. The restaurant is wheelchair accessible, accepts credit cards, takes reservations, and provides table service, take‑out, and catering for groups and families, though it lacks Wi‑Fi and traditional car parking options. Noise is average, making it suitable for a relaxed lunch or dinner, and the casual dress code matches the laid‑back ambiance. Diners can expect friendly, attentive service during slower periods, but during busy times staff may be hurried and restroom facilities can be less tidy, with occasional lighting issues. Overall, Yianni's delivers solid Greek and seafood fare in a family‑ and group‑friendly environment at reasonable prices.
rejected.review_text: Food was good. Service was terrible.  Yiannis gets you because they are the first Greek restaurant you see once you park your car. Walk a little further for better service. We wasted our afternoon waiting on lunch.

chosen.review_text: Big fan of this shop. I've had issues in the past with 3 different dealers in the area and have never had a problem here. I've been going here primarily for routine maintenance and 2 unrelated major items. 1 was a slow coolant leak and another was a known issue causing carbon build up in the intake at the approximate milage that my car had. After the big cleaning, this is like a totally different car. MPG's are back, power is restored, he had the car back to me ahead of schedule and was within the estimate I was given. I will continue to recommend this shop to anybody with a VAG car.

rejected.review_text:
This wing zone is getting one star for their customer service. I have placed three delivery orders online and three times my orders were incorrect. The first two times they made up for it, this last time.   This last time however they left my sandwich prep out of my order, yes it's only lettuce tomato and onion I don't know why they don't do pickles, That's kind of weird. So I called the restaurant and spoke to a lady who was nice, she said that the delivery driver would bring my sandwich prep back out to me, since I live in a high-rise I waited 20 minutes and then I went down so I could meet him out in front of the building as I did with my original order. 20 minutes after that I get a call from the delivery driver asking me if I still wanted it. I thought that that was a ridiculous phone call to make since I have been out there waiting for 20 minutes for them. I said yes I've been waiting for 20 minutes I said but I guess now it sounds like you haven't even started to bring them to me so maybe not, the phone was silent I did not hear another word from him I said  this is not very good customer service, don't bring them. Then I called back the restaurant spoke to the same lady who was nice again and she said he had them in the car out for delivery I told her what he said when he called it didn't sound like he was out for delivery with them he acted like, "are you sure you want them?"... three strikes and you're out Wing Zone. 
To their credit their hamburgers are very good their wings are very good but the shrimp is nasty as hell don't get it.

Also I don't think they change their fryer grease often enough as sometimes it takes pretty old.

chosen.review_text: So I like in VA but while visiting my fiancé's friend we stopped in Luekens per my request and because they kept telling me how much better it is than the ABC store in VA. I must say I was impressed the prices were cheaper and the store itself was the size of 2 ABC stores they had beer and wine also. They even had items at discounted prices like crown royal rye whiskey which I purchased for $10 for a 375ml bottle just to try because I love the vanilla crown royal. When I got to the register the salesman was very nice and pleasant. Also they are building another store and moving to a new location I can't imagine how nice that one will be.

rejected.review_text: This place was a pretty cool spot to grab a bite to eat on the beach. They had wings for $6 I believe and drinks were $3 they also had fireball shots for $2. My wings were good I had plain old buffalo but the bartender let us try a couple other sauces and the hot honey garlic was good. The only sucky part about the restaurant was that if you wanted to sit at the bar inside the restaurant you had to smell all the cigarette smoke from the customers sitting at the outside bar which depending how the wind is blowing is annoying. If I visited again I'd probably just sit a a table further back to eliminate that issue.

Have it only "Their Way"

I have now been there a few times and will not go back. Coffee only the way the want to serve it‍

user_profile: Kim is a detail‑oriented diner who values reliable service and quality food over brand name, and tends to be outspoken when expectations are not met. Her ideal setting is a casual, family‑friendly spot with a relaxed, unpretentious vibe—think a neighborhood café or diner rather than a loud sports‑bar chain. rejected.review_text: This is the worst experience I've ever had at a car dealership in my life. My fleet company sent a courtesy delivery to this dealership. I called three times to confirm a date for delivery and no one ever called me back. Five days before we drove from Kentucky to Tampa to get it, I called and talked to the manager who guaranteed me it would be ready when we arrived. It wasn't. We were treated like a nuisance, no one bothered to show us anything on the vehicle and then when we left and drove down the road, we realized the A/C was not in working order. No air-conditioning in Florida is a problem. So we went back and it took them 15 minutes to take the car back to begin to get it fixed.  My company paid these yahoos $700 to do absolutely nothing. I wouldn't buy a car here if my life depended on it. Go anywhere else. I strongly recommend Brandon Ford. There is one person here who seems to have some interest in customer service. His name is Ricky, he's new but he probably won't be here for very long.  He's way too conscientious for this bunch. Run save, yourself!

chosen.review_text:
The renowned Los Agaves in beautiful Santa Barbara.  I came here on a recommendation from a friend who used to go to UCSB and has only said amazing things about this place.  How good this place was indeed!

It's not a traditional sit-down restaurant with table service but more of an order at the cashier and then sit down.  I ordered their Agaves Burrito which I was surprised to see there was Mahi Mahi inside; the dish comes with rice and salad.  When it came out, it was HUGE; there was also an amazing sauce that drenched the burrito.  I absolutely love Mexican food, and this was spot on.

My friend ordered their earth and sea Moljacetes, and that was just as amazing as well.  The sauce in it is a little spicy and has a kick but the meats in it are cooked very well.

Now I know why this place has such rave reviews and if I'm ever in the area again, this is a definite must go-to place!

rejected.review_text:
Took a day trip out to St. Louis from Chicago and was just looking for places to see and do, and 360 St. Louis came up!

It's located within the Hilton rooftop hotel and be mindful that you'll need security to scan you up to the rooftop bar.  Going up the speedy elevator, the doors open, and you experience a beautiful view of St. Louis and of course the arch!

The name really is what it says to be "360 St. Louis" as there are large glass windows all throughout the restaurant and a great outdoor patio area overlooking the stadium.  The interior was definitely an upscale lounge which is totally me. 

I had a relatively large lunch so just wanted to get a snack and a drink.  I will say their appetizers are a little overpriced as you're looking into the $12 range and the portions are tiny! I ordered the sesame chicken skewers and it was just okay.  

This is definitely more of a place to have drinks and hang out but I wouldn't say a place to eat.

rejected.review_text: We were at the St. Pete airport and decided to find a good local pizza spot to do a one bite official review. We found Joto's as it had good reviews on Yelp. rejected.review_text:
By far, the worst experience I've ever had in a restaurant. Food took over 3 hours to arrive and staff way beyond rude. To top it off, 20% gratuity was included without discussion and general manager refused to accommodate at all. Plus, restaurant was empty on a Friday night. Bye.


Update:
Actually, 7 people arrived at 7:10 and then myself and my fiancé arrived last at 7:20 - not sure why you keep insisting we were so late. There's no reason grilled calamari, gazpacho and Mac and cheese should take an hour in an empty restaurant.  The final bill was split 3 ways - 20% gratuity included which was not up for discussion. Lastly, we didn't want to come back the very next day for another meal (which was your solution to our complaints). We live 45 minutes away and frankly, don't want it.  

Seems like a refresher in a hospitality course may be helpful.

chosen.review_text:
My cousin and I stopped here for lunch. The bar/restaurant is an open concept allowing the view of the Gulf.  The bartender Mike was friendly, very accommodating and attentive. I ordered the $2 beer special, eggnog.  Sounds strange but it was quite tasty. Sea Dog drafts are $5 which is very reasonable for a small brewery. Happy hour lowers the price by $1.00. Mike explained that vodka is also made in house. The gentleman seated near us ordered a dirty martini which was tempting. We ordered the fish and chips and asked the order to be split. We each had two pieces of fish, French fries and coleslaw.  The food was middle of the road and pricey, $17, but with us splitting the meal and the generous serving we were ok with that. 

I will definitely stop in again to taste other beers and to enjoy the view. Parking is tight but it is free.

rejected.review_text:
What a difference a year makes. Three of us met for our monthly girls lunch out. The day was beautiful and we wanted to be seated near the water. Called ahead for reservations but was informed that it's first come, first serve on the seating. Hmmm. We arrived and were able to sit in the sun outside so we worked on our tans too. Lisa was attentive but the food was really slow coming out after we placed our orders. We shared crab dip, I ordered the lunch combo with a cup of lackluster lobster bisque (taste was okay but no lobster, did have a tiny chunk of white fish) and wedge salad, friend ordered shrimp appetizer and the other lady had the butter burger.  All okay but not exceptional. 

This was truly my go-to restaurant is 2017 but will not be in the rotation again for a long time. Food was so-so and with so much competition, I will be trying others places before going back - if ever.

chosen.review_text:
Dillian K is a GOD!! I have very short white blonde ( and very damaged- due to at home bleaching done by myself) and missed my length but didn't want to give up that color I tried so hard to get. I've never had hand toe sew in's and I was nervous. I've seen girls with extensions that were obvious and looked awful.. I left his salon with that Beyoncé attitude.. I had people asking me left and right if my hair was real, they didn't believe it and asked if they could see the extensions cause they needed proof. 
I love the confidence I have when I got my extensions in, they make me feel like I am the real Beyoncé.. I'll never go without again

rejected.review_text: I came in for a full set and initially showed the owner a picture of the color I wanted, which was an ombré silver glitter to black glitter.. I gave her a reference picture to go from and asked her if she could do it to ensure the results would be as expected. Half way through, she asked if I liked it... I said "no that's not at all what I asked you for" .. I showed her the picture (yet again) and then my nails.. she looked at me and asked me what I wanted... I said the picture I showed you.. she then said she couldn't actually do it like that and took it all off. Starting over, she gave me just one silver glitter color on all my nails...not at all what I had asked for and two hours later, charged me full price for something I hadn't wanted from the beginning

chosen.review_text:
I've gotten my brows waxed here on three different occasions.

Brows
If you are trying to grow out your brows they are mindful of that. They create nice brow shapes without taking too much off. When I go in for a wax, they not only wax my brows but also trim and tweeze. 

Scheduling
It has been pretty easy for me. I just text Leanne and she gets me scheduled. She also sends reminders for appointments. Never really had to wait more than a few minutes when I arrive for my appointment. Also I just noticed that they have online scheduling available through their website.

chosen.review_text:
What a great option for lunch when you work downtown!  I can pick up some vegetables or meat for dinner during the week, get my lunch, and walk back to work.

Their salad bar always looks fresh and they are constantly restocking, so that's where I usually go first.  It can get a little crowded around lunch time, but the check out line always moves pretty quickly.

Here's a tip: Don't buy too much... (or bring your own cart) - you can't take the carts out of the store.

rejected.review_text:
I've been to Sekisui three times now since moving to Tower Grove in 2009.  The first two times were great.  The service was friendly and fast and sushi was good.  

The third time we decided to order take out and have a sushi snack night at home.  Zack and I ordered some standbys and a couple rolls we hadn't tried before (South Grand and Rock n' Roll). I was not impressed.  There was barely any fish in the rolls!  Like the tip of a pencil eraser.  Also, the specialty rolls were pretty bland.

I thought maybe the other reviews were wrong, but after checking it out last night, I would agree with them. Something's changed.  I probably won't go back here again.

chosen.review_text: Amazing pizza!! The pizza is thin (New York style has to be floppy!), the crust is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside (like a perfect loaf of French bread), the sauce is fanatic and fresh (tastes like vine ripe tomatoes), and the cheese is great and has a hint of sharpness (love it!). The whole pie is simply fabulous. Great job guys! Hands down, The Pizza Effect is my new favorite pizza joint.

chosen.review_text:
My wife and I dined for the first time last evening with another couple at this gem of a seafood restaurant hidden away in Bristol Borough. I am pleased to join the many enthusiastic reviewers on multiple social media platforms singing its praises. 

Yes, the food was delicious. I had the crab cakes which were every bit as good as those I've enjoyed eating in Annapolis, Maryland. My wife ordered the Bronzino, her favorite fish, and she also said it was as good as any she's eaten. 

And yes, the service was excellent. No complaints whatsoever. 

My less than positive comments which follow are purely objective, and while they won't prevent us from dining there again, I share them in case you might find them helpful:

1. We had made a reservation to dine inside for 7:00 PM. For some reason our table wasn't ready and we were told we would have to wait indefinitely for it, so we accepted the offer to be seated immediately under the tent outside. But it was an especially warm evening weather wise and had I known in advance that I would be seated outside I would have worn shorts like a number of other patrons. My main complaint, though, is not so much the outside dining but that our reservation to dine inside was not honored. 

2. Prepare to be seated on hard wooden chairs; a redundant description, I know, but we found them uncomfortable. You might want to consider bringing your own cushion if hard seating bothers you. We looked inside and the seats were the same there too. The bottom line is that a restaurant can serve you the best tasting food in the world, but what good is it if you're hurting in your seat while eating it?

3. The restaurant is perhaps too pricey. We spent $150 per couple, but it could and should have been less costly. For example, $12 is way too expensive for the extremely small portion of lettuce wedge they serve as a salad. As a BYOB this restaurant isn't making its money on serving alcohol, but it's compensating by overcharging for other items like my small basic salad. We have also eaten excellent crab cakes and Bronzino for less money at other area restaurants. 

4. The menu is short on Sides. Only two were offered: garlic mashed potatoes and string beans. If you don't happen to like either of them, you may be going home hungry. There are plenty of fish to choose from on the menu, but I don't know what the chef seems to have against vegetables, limiting the choices to two. 

5. Finally, despite a few spaces dedicated to the restaurant out front, parking is on the street. We parked two blocks away and it was a pleasant walk back to our car in the warm weather, but we would have been a lot less happy if we had to sprint those two blocks in the rain. 

I should note that despite my comments above the restaurant was full to capacity. I don't know if that was because people are just grateful to dine out again as the post-Covid world begins returning to normal or because the food and service at this restaurant are so good. I suspect it was a combination of both, and I am happy to see that this business has not only survived the pandemic, but appears to be thriving.

rejected.review_text:
On June 2, a few days after I had posted my review, the manager from Del Frisco's contacted me via Yelp, offered his apology for our experience, assured me that his team was looking into it, and that someone from management would reach out to me within five days with an appropriate resolution.

I heard nothing further from Del Frisco's, so on June 23 I messaged the manager that it's been three weeks since I was supposed to hear back from them in five days. Crickets. 

There is a happy ending, though. Our daughter's in-laws were in town this week and we met them for dinner -- at Barclay Prime. The bill was in excess of $600 but my steak was done to perfection and the service was worthy of the price. Message to Del Frisco's: Stephen Starr extends his personal thanks to you for sending more business his way.

rejected.review_text:
I was having trouble finding exactly what I wanted in a tux shirt for my wedding, so I went in three weeks beforehand to order a tuxedo shirt. Stephon helped me. He was a little unsure with the computer and needed help a couple times working their system, but he was polite and apologetic. The shirt came in a day late, but I still had a week before the wedding, so I was okay. 

When I went in to pick it up, it did not have the French cuffs I had ordered and expected. Apparently there was a miscommunication, but I was clear with him when I went in there that I needed this for my formal wedding this upcoming Saturday. He told me that I had signed off on one button mitered cuffs and this was the shirt I ordered. However, the samples he showed me were all French cuffs. I expected a French cuff with one button and mitered. That is all we talked about. I believe it should have been his job as the professional to make sure that the form was correct and that I fully understood what he had me sign, because what I was looking at when I ordered it was a French cuff with one button and a mitered corner. I also don't understand why anyone would order a shirt with studs, but no French cuffs. 

He told me there was no manager on duty who could help me at this time and that this was the shirt I ordered and maybe I should go look for another shirt given that my wedding was that weekend. He said he would see what he could do when I explained to him that this was not the shirt I expected. After I left the store and took his suggestion by going to another store to purchase a new shirt, he called to say that he could have the tailor put in a button hole so that I could wear cufflinks; however, it will still not be a French cuff shirt. 

I never heard back from him or the store manager, and it is now almost two weeks later. I've called back and left messages for her without any response. This has probably been one of the worst shopping experiences I've ever experienced and would not recommended going there to anyone under any circumstances.

chosen.review_text:
My wife wanted to try something new for her birthday dinner so, we went to Bourbon Steak. This restaurant was amazing and it lived up to the hype! The food was great! The ambiance was great to celebrate her birthday and the view of the city at night was icing on the cake! Due to covid the tables were not on top of each other and they made sure to wipe down the table and chairs in between each guest. 

Okay, now let's discuss our meal. The resteraunt provides complimentary fries with various seasoning on the fries and suggested dipping sauces to compliment the fri. This was different and the fries were good but, don't eat to many of them otherwise you want eat your dinner. For cocktails we had lemon drop and Long Island ice tea, both cocktails were great. For an appetizer we hade the instant bacon, make sure to try the shaved brussel sprouts that are under the bacon. I had the pan roasted Chilean sea bass, my wife had the bone in New York strip steak. Our side dish was a stuffed baked potato and crispy brussel sprouts. I will say it took longer than anticipated for our entrees to be served. We ordered the steak medium well and with most places this is like rolling the dice because your not sure what will come out but, the steak was cooked as ordered. 

With regards to cost, the prices were consistent with an upscale steak house and I was not disappointed with the cost, the serving size or quality of food. I will be back and use this establishment to entertain family, friends and business associates.

rejected.review_text:
This place was highly recommend by several people so, I had to try it. I was disappointed because they advertise catfish but, they serve Swai. This may work for others but, I want US Catfish not Swai. I don't like being mislead by advertising catfish. I am in the food industry so, I am pretty familiar with the difference. If I had known this was Swai, I would have tried the whiting. 
Once I arrived, I saw they only accept cash so, I had to go to Dollar General to buy something and get cash back. I later realized there was an ATM in the shopping center near Helens Chicken but, this was not a big issue but be prepared so, have your cash ready no credit cards. 
The food was hot but, if you don't tell them no hot sauce or to place it on the side they dump it on your fish. That was a problem for me but once I looked at the fish and realized it was Swai it wouldn't have mattered. 
I will say the service was prompt, the food came out hot and the employee I met at the window of the drive through was pleasant. Because, they gave me spaghetti but, I wanted french fries so, they gave me an order of fries with no hassle. 
I will support black owned and operated businesses so, I will be back but I will order the whiting.

He prefers places that offer outdoor seating, free Wi‑Fi, ample parking (or bike parking) and a relaxed dress code, and is comfortable with pets where allowed. Service that is prompt and accurate is important to him—he is willing to wait a short time for food but gets annoyed by long delays for basic items like water or missing components in take‑out orders. Overall, CF is moderately exacting: he will return to a spot that delivers decent food and a comfortable atmosphere, but he is quick to point out sloppy service or quality lapses.

Newtown Athletic Club in Newtown, PA is a full‑service athletic and wellness center that combines gym facilities, a pool, golf instruction, yoga, Pilates, and a wide range of fitness classes throughout the day, along with event‑planning services and dietitian support. The club accepts insurance and credit cards, offers free Wi‑Fi, bike parking, and a dedicated parking lot, and is wheelchair accessible and kid‑friendly. Equipment is described as high‑quality and well‑maintained, with a variety of cardio and weight options, and the locker rooms are noted as stylish and clean. Membership fees are higher than budget‑oriented gyms but are positioned as a strong value given the extensive amenities and class selection. The atmosphere is polished and accommodating, suitable for both serious training and casual recreation, though the price point may be a consideration for cost‑sensitive patrons.
rejected.review_text:
First thing - this might be actually worth it if you have a family membership and 4 kids that you sign up for tons of classes. The best word I can use to describe it would be Chaos - I dreaded dropping off my kid for classes and waiting - it was like you trying to stand still on a sidewalk in times square but add in kids running amok while parents played with their phones instead of watching them. 

I agree with the pool chemicals always being off and the therapy pool being gross - several times it was closed due to a "code brown" as they call it. Always managed to find band-aids floating around in there too.

I also agree with the kids club - I had the same experience with my kids going from liking it to not wanting to go there.

Lots of affluenza all around - I resigned just shy of 10 years

chosen.review_text: The best place to get a facial!  Raquel is great - a very calming person to be around.  Very professional, friendly and knowledgeable.  A couple of years ago she recommended certain products for me, and I've been using them ever since with fantastic results.  Her suite is very easy to find (State and Canon Perdido) and lots of easy parking nearby (Nordstrom parking lots as well as Fiesta 5 parking lot).  I can't wait to get another facial from her!!

rejected.review_text: They do a so so  job and very unorganized, the car looked like they missed spots while washing it the dash board looked like they just ran a towel over it and the tires were not dressed that well. chosen.review_text: My friends and I came to Philly from NYC on a day trip to try out cheesesteak and then go out for dessert. We found this place on our Yelp radar and boy are we glad we did. I got the Franklin Mint sundae, and it tasted amazing. I couldn't taste the mint until I continued my excursion deep into the sundae, which added a sense of discovery to my taste buds. The fudge was really heavy and creamy, and to be honest, it felt like I was going to gain five pounds my eating all of it. In the end, I couldn't finish the sundae, but I really wish I had the energy to do so.

rejected.review_text: Came here for dinner. The whole vibe in this part of the neighborhood was great on a Saturday night, although this particular restaurant was pretty empty. Nonetheless, the interior looked nice enough and I was excited to try some Thai food. I got massaman curry with beef and my friend had the drunken noodles. I thought my dish was okay -- it was great but it had a lot of the sweet flavor but was missing a lot of the tangy taste that I was expecting. Maybe I was getting the wrong dish if I was expecting that taste. Nonetheless, I thought the drunken noodles were pretty lackluster. They had zero richness in terms of flavor and the noodles themselves were very dry and rigid. Overall a pretty average, or even sub average experience.

chosen.review_text: I love this place! Absolutely the best Po'Boys outside of Orleans. They are not stingy here in any way, even the seafood Po'Boys are overflowing. Lots of different (and spicy!) unlimited sides. I didn't care for their style of muffuletta tho, it's on French bread rather than sourdough and too oily for my taste. It's usually very busy at lunch when I go, so much so I've had to share a table a couple of times, but that was fine. For me the service has always been spot on and if you can tolerate a short wait for your free sides when they're busy I think you'll agree. You order at the counter, grab your silverware and find a table so it's not a sit down, waiter, tablecloth and candles type of place. And above all this they're just a great bunch of folks and give back to the community in different ways. YOU MUST GO! Trust me on this.

rejected.review_text: I tried Twin Peaks for 1st time today and likely my last. It wasn't busy at 4:00 and I was greeted, seated and waited on very quickly. Since I was working I had iced tea so can't comment on beer selection. I have no complaints with service or server. Elizabeth was friendly and efficient. Very limited menu though. A handful of appetizers, about half dozen burgers a couple of chicken sandwiches and fish tacos. Also a few "dinner" type offerings. I'm not necessarily a healthy type eater but if you are you'll go hungry here. I ordered the chicken ranch. It was very sloppy so watch out shirt front and way over seasoned. It had so much pepper on it I'm afraid I'm going to regret it tomorrow morning. Same way with the fire fries, way too much salty cajun seasoning on frozen steak cut fries. All in all they're just meh. 4 stars though for waitress objectifying, I feel like I have to leave a bigger tip...is there a term for this? I'll have to call A Way With Words.

chosen.review_text: I've always been told there are three things in life that you have to hit smack on right: a good accountant, a good stylist, and a good, honest mechanic. I have at least found one of them. The guys at Am-Tech Automotive are awesome. They smile when you come in, They are polite. They're clean. Which I'm sure is very hard to do in that line of work. They don't make up problems so you spend more money. This was the second time I had gone to them - both times for state inspection. Last year cost me almost nothing to my delight, but I knew I had stuff coming this year. They were very patient with my questions and fully explained what the problems they found were and how they were going to remedy them with my permission. They were super professional all the way right down to the end. I had sent at least two other people from my office their way and they were extremely satisfied as well. I think the reason they're all so nice and care is because they're not a bunch of lackeys stuck making minimum wage. THESE GUYS CARE. They all have a stake in the business and they obviously know that the way you treat a customer makes or breaks whether they come back or not. Hence, pride in their job. I would recommend Amtech to anyone in the Norristown area or anywhere!

rejected.review_text:
Came here for the first time today and was very surprised with my experience after reading the other reviews. My sister and I had an appointment at 9 am for manicures and we were greeted and sat down right away. An employee sat down to start my sisters nails and when she was done gluing the tips on her nails she said she has to blow her nose and would be back.  Well...the employee came back into the room and started a pedicure on another customer!!! 45 MINUTES later (after finishing the other customers pedicure) she went back to my sister and finished her full set. We had an appointment at 9am and my sister had to sit there and wait 45 minutes. I found it incredibly rude for that employee to start her nails and then leave in the middle to do a pedicure for another customer!! In addition they had 2 other employees in the back not doing anything so I was confused as to why they didn't have someone else finish my sisters nails. 

Now the male who did my nails didn't really understand what I wanted. I told him I wanted a gel manicure and instead he gave me a full set gel manicure. He said it would look better because I wanted my nails square shaped. BUT they came out looking great!! He did a really good job and I will be more clear next time.  

When it came time to pay the total came out to $78. I gave her my card and paid the amount not knowing that they only accept cash for tips. They REALLY need to have a sign on the door saying that. Because it's such an inconvenience for someone who doesn't carry cash. Also they overcharged me. According to their pamphlet it is $27 for an acrylic full set and $46 for a gel full set which adds up to $73 unfortunately I didn't realize this until I got home. I think we should've received a discount instead of being overcharged. 

Wasn't impressed for my first time at this establishment.

chosen.review_text:
Gastronomy is the art of craving. Most of it is not physical; senses are merely the warming embraces of the hidden desires. Sweetie Pie's penetrates all such embraces and arouses one's most deeply embedded cravings. Something very primal is being touched by the pungent smells, humid smokes, and almost grotesque appearance of the food items that await their transpiration. But the rawness of such embodiment and catalyst of craving only revives the remoteness of their sublime origins. Their barbeque ribs are the harp of Venus, their fried catfish is the boat of Neptune, and their fried chicken, the wings of Mercury, You can't escape the seduction of heavenly bodies. You end up craving the remaining traces of their water, grass, mud and stones. 

In short, the food is divine. So is their sweet tea of course.

chosen.review_text:
I was on a work trip and needed a quick cut. I was a walk in and there were great about working me in quickly. My stylist was John-Paul? John-something? A really cute guy with two first names. He was warm and fun. I asked him about cutting my bangs and he assured me they were the best part of my existing cut. Well, damn if he wasn't right. I walked out with a sassy new cut that led to a lot of compliments. 

If I lived in the area I would be a regular. 

Just a tip the salon is actually IN the mall. I didn't realize that at first and had a little trouble finding it.

I had the BBQ shrimp which was soooo yummy. Being a Northerner this dish was like nothing I've had before. Giant shrimp swimming in a pool of deliciousness served with a big hunk of bread. I washed it all down with a couple Abitas and completely satisfied. 

My friends from the area suggested that I stuff myself with as much shrimp as possible while I was in NOLA and I did! The shrimp really is different there. It's tastier, HUGE and cooked to perfection. Eat up!

If you are looking at this property you are likely looking for a decent budget option and if that is what you are looking for read on.
The location is pretty ok, but you will run into many homeless along the way. There is nothing the property can do about that, but if you don't feel comfortable in this environment, this might be a let down.

chosen.review_text: This is my second time having this pizza and I really love it. I live in Cincinnati, Ohio and this place would be great to have! Also, I grew up in Indiana and it's known for having cheese sauce for breadsticks and pizza, but in Ohio I get looked at like I'm crazy for asking for cheese sauce! Donatos is the only place that has cheese ( good nacho cheese), not even Pizza Hut there has cheese and I LOVE CHEESE SAUCE! So, I love your cheese sauce as well as the pizza. Please open up in Cincy!!

rejected.review_text:
This place had good food but definitely qualifies for that restaurant rescue show! 
They have a good but weird crab Rangoon flatbread that's just random on the menu. The pizzas were good- thin crust gives a ton more toppings than their hand tossed. The server we had was forgetful about everything and didn't own up to any mistakes at all. I asked her for a to go box 3 times and finally went to the server station to get my box in which she said, "Oh I was bringing g that to you." She also said that she put my friends order in correctly and didn't know why they didn't make a thin crust. She heard us discussing how she had responded because her response was once again, something to the effect of "I put it in correctly, I don't know what happened and my friend asked how long it would take and she said a long time as in another 20 minutes as of it were burdening her to make this happen as quickly as possible."

He gravitates toward American‑style fare such as inventive pizza toppings, solid brunch dishes, quality coffee, and appreciates establishments that offer a good selection of draught or craft beer. He prefers unpretentious, family‑friendly venues with casual dress code, free Wi‑Fi, bike or street parking, and the option for outdoor seating or take‑out; reservations and upscale décor are not essential. rejected.review_text: Had a "debris" sandwich. Bread was kind of stale. None of our party were particularly impressed. I bumped the review up by a star because one could make the argument it's a New Orleans institution, the decor is interesting, and they actually have a beer that's not Bud/Light/Miller. I recommend skipping it.

user_profile: Yas favors straightforward, budget‑friendly meals that are served quickly in a relaxed, casual atmosphere. The user enjoys protein‑rich and flavorful cuisines such as Ethiopian (spicy kitfo), Hawaiian‑style poke bowls with plenty of fresh toppings, and Mediterranean/ Lebanese fare, preferring dishes that are fresh, generously portioned, and affordably priced. Yas looks for venues that are low‑key and family‑friendly, with casual dress codes, free Wi‑Fi, bike parking, credit‑card acceptance, and easy takeout or delivery options, while reserving a spot for places that provide reliable parking and are kid‑appropriate. Cleanliness and a safe, comfortable environment are important, and the user expects prompt, courteous service and consistent flavor; slow service, bland food, unprofessional staff, or unsafe surroundings are quickly deemed unacceptable. Overall, Yas is value‑sensitive, opting for low‑ to mid‑range price points that deliver good portion size and quality, and tends to be fairly critical when expectations around food quality, speed, and safety are not met.

chosen.business_profile: Oishii Poké in Philadelphia, PA is a casual, low‑priced poke shop that blends Hawaiian‑Japanese flavors with some Mexican influence, ideal for a quick lunch. The self‑service format features average noise, free Wi‑Fi, wheelchair‑accessible indoor seating, and a casual dress code. Credit cards are accepted with a $10 minimum (cash required for smaller orders), and there is no alcohol service. Parking options include garage and street spots plus bike racks. The venue is kid‑friendly, caters events, accommodates groups, and offers both delivery and takeout, though it has no outdoor seating, reservations, or table service. Prices are in the lowest tier (price range 1), with unlimited add‑ins for around $9‑$10, but sauce and eel portions may be modest. Friendly, efficient staff and extended holiday hours add convenience for busy diners.

rejected.review_text:
Don't recommend for services or for future students 

I attended the school a few years ago and from the very first day of class realized I made a mistake. My instructor was immature, unprofessional and a bully. Her behavior made the students comfortable enough to bully others in the classroom (me) and nothing was done about it. I was talked about, called names & yelled at by another student & my pregnant redhead instructor.

It got so bad I went to the office to discuss what was going on and basically blamed because my personality wasn't "bubbly" and my instructor said I was being standoffish. The school is not good for POC and you're not going to feel confident when you graduate. I could have watched YouTube tutorials at home instead of wasting my money.

If you decide to get services done just keep in mind most of the students are nervous and not really being trained in the best way. I was self taught before going to this school all they did was give me my hours & a piece of paper.

chosen.review_text:
Atmosphere: Get it to go. Not alot of places to sit and outside can be unbearably hot (well.. for tourists like me). Watching the restaurant mayhem while your order is coming up is a thing of beauty.

Service: Worth it. Know what you want when you get there. Get in line. Speak clearly and loudly. Then, Get outta the way. (Thats for the customers behind you. The people working here are very nice)

Food: Without a doubt the best deviled crabs in flordia. (I know... Thats enough to get me beat-up) It's worth it though. I've been going to a diffrent shop for years to get my devil crabs and cubans. No longer. Light and crispy with the right amount of spice. This _IS_ the end all be all when it comes to cubans and deviled crabs.

Bottom Line: The cream of the crop, there is none higher. Sucker Deviled crabs should call them Sire.... You will not be disappointed.

rejected.review_text:
Atmosphere: Umm.. Ok. What has Yelp guided me to here. Small even for a strip-mall restaurant. Big T.V.'s featuring Telemundo and (on good nights) soccer. Despite being kinda scary the bathrooms are clean. 

Service: Very nice. Friendly enough to put an already edgy tourist at ease and still cater to the large squad of locals who make it a regular spot. 

Food: It starts with the chips... Real, homemade, fresh, chips & salsa. As soon as it hit the table I knew it was something special. Tacos were outstanding. (Yet again, wonderfully delicious, home made tortillas) Chicken with the right amount of spice and cojito cheese crumbled on top. The burrito was as big as my head. (Yes, I have a rather bulbous noggin) So good it nearly made me cry in my ice cold beer. 

Bottom Line: Not a place to take a 1st date.(Might scare them a bit) The food though... wow. Not to be missed. You can keep your fancy-schmancy Americanized Mexican food. This is the real deal. worth your time.

user_profile: Niki is a friendly, curious eater who enjoys exploring casual spots with a lively, slightly trendy vibe and appreciates when service is warm and efficient. She favors Mexican fare such as tacos, empanadas, and burritos, as well as hearty pretzel‑based snacks and premium ice‑cream treats, and she looks for places that offer vegan options and fresh‑made desserts. Preferred ambience is casual‑but‑stylish settings with outdoor seating, bike‑friendly parking, free Wi‑Fi, and a relaxed happy‑hour atmosphere rather than formal or upscale dining. She expects staff to be attentive and courteous; delayed service, understaffed windows, or lax health‑safety practices (e.g., mask‑less food prep) are noted as drawbacks. Her price comfort zone sits in the low‑to‑mid range (price levels 1‑2), though she is willing to pay a premium for high‑quality ice cream or specialty items. Practical preferences include credit‑card acceptance, easy takeout or delivery, reservation options when available, wheelchair accessibility, and kid‑friendliness, with a particular appreciation for bike parking. Overall, Niki is moderately discerning—appreciative of good food and friendly service but forgiving as long as basic cleanliness and convenience are met.

user_profile: Aaron is an adventurous yet discerning foodie who enjoys exploring distinct drinks and eclectic eats while valuing attentive service and well‑maintained spaces. He gravitates toward cocktails, craft coffee, donuts, and casual American fare as well as Cajun‑Creole bar foods and Vietnamese‑sushi hybrids, favoring menus that offer both familiar comfort and flavorful twists. His ideal spots are hip‑ster, trendy or intimate venues with a lively but not overwhelming atmosphere—often with outdoor seating, a relaxed noise level, and a touch of class, yet he also appreciates a laid‑back dive vibe when the food is solid. Aaron expects friendly, knowledgeable staff who can personalize orders quickly and keep the environment clean; he is quick to praise top‑notch service but is unimpressed by worn‑out décor, stains, or any sense of cheapness. He prefers mid‑range pricing that delivers clear value—willing to splurge on a standout cocktail experience but reluctant to overpay for subpar food. chosen.review_text: WOW! I have traveled the world specifically looking for the most unique and best cocktails. Attaboy has taken my soul! Hey he best cocktails, amazing service and a niche atmosphere. You can't go wrong knocking on the door. Literally, you have to knock on the door and wait until a server lets you in! It's 100% worth any wait you might face! The cocktails are not just next level but are beyond your expectations. Let your server know what you like and dislike and let him/her craft your dream cocktail!

rejected.review_text:
Overall, I can't say I would stay here again. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is beautiful and artfully/seductively decorative putting you in the "lets enjoy NOLA" vibe. It is also located steps from night life and historic attractions. 

Here's why I give it a 3 star. The St Hotel seems like it's trying to compete with the Ritz Carlton (which is next door) but it feel short in my book. Our room was beautiful at first glance but after a closer look over the preceding 3 days seemed  we began to notice rips and tears in the furniture, stains on the unused bathrobe and an all around cheapness to the decor. Don't get me wrong, I spend most my spare time backpacking the woods and staying in the most "off-the-beaten-path" motels and by no means "gucci." I just expected a bit more for the price. 

I will say the customer service was top-notch, among the best I have ever experienced. Everyone was willing to jump through a flaming hoop to ensure your stay was pleasant.

Ultimately, my biggest complaint was the food. While not bad, it was not great, actually far from it, yet they charged more than the higher end hotels such as the Roosevelt or the Ritz.  In the end if I ever travel back to NOLA, for the price, I will stay elsewhere.

user_profile: Klara is a laid‑back, value‑oriented diner who gravitates toward casual American comfort food and craft‑beer venues, enjoying brunch staples like hearty breakfast sandwiches, eggs and gravies, as well as simple bar bites such as cheese dips and sizable cocktails. She prefers lively yet relaxed atmospheres—family‑friendly spaces with casual dress codes, ample outdoor seating, and dog‑friendly policies—where parking (street, lot, or bike‑rack) is easy to find. Prompt, friendly service and clean, well‑maintained environments matter to her, though she is forgiving of minor slip‑ups if the overall experience remains pleasant. Her spending leans toward the mid‑range (price‑level 1‑2), seeking generous portions and good value rather than premium pricing or elaborate extras. Practical comforts like free Wi‑Fi, reservations when available, and the ability to bring kids or pets are important, and she appreciates venues that offer both indoor and outdoor options and straightforward, efficient check‑in processes.

chosen.business_profile: The Gateway Arch in Saint Louis, MO, is a large stainless‑steel monument that serves as both a historic landmark and a tourist attraction; visitors can ride a tram to an observation deck for panoramic river views and explore the surrounding park, which is spacious and kid‑friendly. The site operates without appointments and is suitable for families, though tram tickets should be purchased ahead of time to ensure access, and signage for entrances and paid areas can be unclear, making navigation occasionally confusing. A shiny visitor center provides informational exhibits, while the museum appears to require a separate ticket for entry. On‑site parking is available, but the immediate area offers few additional activities beyond the arch itself. The experience is best enjoyed on a sunny day with prior planning to maximize the visual and educational benefits.

chosen.review_text:
Great experience! We bought tickets to the North Tram ride to the top. Definitely a small little space with 5 seats but cool at the top. Masks are required at all times for all pictures and while you're there. If you forget your mask, they have them at the entrance. We ended up by all the photos for $50 which include the 2 sets of photos you took with arch backgrounds, digital copies and photo holders. Getting one sheet dor $25 or one set for $30 wasn't really worth it in my opinion otherwise. 

Cool gift shop and museum as well and friendly staff.

rejected.review_text: We showed up a little late to check in on a Saturday evening. I think they had an event going on and weren't doing self-serve parking so it was valet only. user_profile: Ryan is a pragmatic diner who values clear value and efficient service over flashy ambience. He gravitates toward straightforward, affordable fare such as well‑executed pizza and other casual American staples, favoring places that deliver consistent quality without overpricing. His ideal setting is relaxed and family‑friendly—think casual seating, outdoor options, and bike‑friendly parking—while still offering conveniences like credit‑card payment and reliable take‑out or delivery. Speed and reliability are paramount; long waits, disorganized order handling, or any hint of skimped‑off quality quickly turn him away. Overall, Ryan is a fairly exacting customer who expects good food at a fair price, swift service, and basic practical amenities, and he is quick to flag venues that fall short on these fronts.

chosen.business_profile: La Pizzeria Metro in Wilmington, DE offers casual, neighborhood‑style pizza in a relaxed setting, featuring a full bar, indoor TV and average noise levels with both indoor and outdoor seating. Table service is provided, the venue accommodates groups well, and takeout is available; the menu sits at a moderate price range (2) and the restaurant accepts credit cards. On‑site parking is provided in a lot, and the atmosphere is described as casual and friendly with attentive staff. Prices are slightly higher than typical fast‑casual pizzerias, but the fresh ingredients and well‑executed pies are highlighted as worth the cost, while dogs are not permitted.

rejected.review_text:
Don't use this business. They are fraudulent and rude.

We used google to find a vet near our house. We contacted the business, somehow they picked up the phone. They didn't say where they are, booked an appointment and asked my credit card information. I guess technological mistakes can happen.

We arrived at what we thought was the location of the veterinary office and didn't see a vet office. The number we called and took our appointment along with a deposit for $66 became a locksmith company. We thought we had been scammed. Then we received a call from New Jersey (we live in Philadelphia) telling us our appointment was cancelled because we hadn't arrived. We attempted to explain what happened but the receptionist was extremely rude and unsympathetic to what we were saying. She just coldly stated we lost our deposit and it's not her fault that we didn't get it right. And she stated that they only have one phone number which I never called from my phone. I have call log as proof. They also didn't seem concerned that people could be calling them by mistake and making appointments at the wrong location. As long as they get their money, that's the only thing they seem to care about.

user_profile: Pat is a relaxed, sociable eater who gravitates toward flavorful, protein‑focused dishes such as ramen tonkatsu, sushi rolls, hearty burgers, chicken tenders, and authentic Mexican fare, often accompanied by a good beer or cocktail selection; he prefers casual, upbeat venues that are family‑ and group‑friendly, with a lively but not overpowering atmosphere, free Wi‑Fi, bike parking, and optional outdoor seating. He values attentive service and menu variety that offers both sit‑down and reliable take‑out or delivery options, especially when he can enjoy the food while watching a game. His spending habit falls in the moderate (price range 2) tier, seeking generous portions and good value without requiring upscale fine‑dining. Practical amenities like easy reservations, happy‑hour specials, and kid‑friendly features are important, and while he is generally easygoing, he expects the food to be tasty and the service to be courteous.

chosen.business_profile: Con Murphy's in Philadelphia is an Irish‑styled sports bar and nightlife spot that blends a casual, classy ambience with a full bar, live music and multiple TVs, making it well suited for groups looking to watch games or enjoy drinks in an average‑noise setting. The venue offers free Wi‑Fi, dog‑friendliness, wheelchair access, bike parking and several parking options including garage, street and valet, and it accepts credit cards. It serves lunch, dinner and late‑night fare at a moderate $‑range price point, with delivery and takeout available but no table service or reservation system. While the bar and beer selection receive praise and the live music adds energy, the food menu is eclectic and reviews note inconsistency in flavor and execution, so diners may prefer to focus on drinks and simple items. The casual dress code, lack of outdoor seating, and absence of kid‑focused options are additional practical considerations.

chosen.review_text: Best place you will find in this part of town. I came in for a quick dinner on my last trip to Philly. I ate at the bar, and ended up staying for a few hours, chatting and enjoying the atmosphere. I had the house special burger with Irish bacon. It was great but I was feeling guilty so had a side salad instead of fries. I am a bit of a snob when it comes to Guinness, but this was the best pint I've had in a long time.
