rejected.review_text: The tonkatsu is awesome and there are lots of options on the menu for everyone else. Even the takeout is good but get it home before it gets cold.

user_profile: Nene is a detail‑oriented diner who expects clean, well‑maintained spaces and prompt, attentive service. She tends toward casual American comfort food such as burgers, grills and bar‑style meals, and is open to Asian‑inspired quick bites like Vietnamese rolls, provided they are prepared hygienically. Her ideal ambience is relaxed and family‑friendly rather than upscale, with easy access to free Wi‑Fi and straightforward seating. Service must be swift: orders taken promptly, food delivered hot, and staff responsive without long waits or repeated neglect. She prefers mid‑range pricing that delivers good value and appreciates practical conveniences such as available parking, take‑out or delivery options, and the ability to order without extensive reservations. Overall, Nene is a strict critic of poor cleanliness, slow service, and cold or mishandled food, favoring establishments that meet high standards of hygiene and efficiency.

chosen.business_profile: Eggroll Queen Cafe in Chalfont, PA is a casual Vietnamese‑style café that centers its menu on a large selection of specialty egg rolls alongside comfort‑food items such as cheesesteak, mac & cheese, Korean beef and French toast; the ambience is low‑key with a TV for background entertainment and no upscale or romantic atmosphere. Parking options are limited and the restaurant does not offer delivery, but take‑out is encouraged—calling 20–30 minutes ahead helps manage the busy periods that can lead to moderate wait times. The venue can become crowded, tables may show residual crumbs, and occasional hygiene lapses (e.g., stray hair) have been reported, so cleanliness can be variable. It is a budget‑friendly spot with a wide roll menu suitable for quick casual eats, but guests should be aware of the lack of dedicated parking and the potential for a noisy, bustling environment.

chosen.review_text: First time going here to grab some rolls on 10/3. I thought this was a neat concept and I was really looking forward to trying these egg rolls. I ordered a buffalo chicken roll and two chicken parm rolls. I waited about 15 minutes for my rolls to be finished. In the mean time I sat inside and waited. The tables were dirty and covered in crumbs. I looked pass that since I wasn't eating in. I got my rolls and left. As I was headed home I decided to try the rolls. I started with the buffalo chicken roll which was just some buffalo chicken dip....not much flavor and totally not what I expected. Then the chicken parm roll....same thing, lack of seasoning and not enough cheese. Then I took another bite and there was a long blonde hair in my roll. I stopped eating. I didn't go back because I was already close to home and I figured I only spent $8 and I was supporting a local business. But I think the people cooking should have to wear hair nets for sanitary reasons. Not sure I'll go back again.

rejected.review_text: I wish I would have read the reviews before purchasing from this place. I placed an order 9/14. I was told they aren't allowed inside and that it would be a curbside delivery and I was being charged $99 for delivery. That should have been a red flag. I waited 6 weeks for this furniture to show up. There was no communication as to when it was coming. I had to reach out to them to make sure it was coming. When they finally decided to send my couch, the workers seem uninterested in being there. We could instantly tell that the one piece was too big. Meanwhile the other worker is ready to push this piece off the truck without a care in the world. Long story short, my boyfriend told them to take it back. He told me that the driver proceeded to say that his time was wasted and they came from west Philadelphia for nothing. I'm sorry he felt that way. Also I signed no paper when he took the couch back and I got no phone call to ask what happened. Poor customer service. And I just learned they don't give you your money back so now I gotta go above them. Smh. BUYER BEWARE DO NOT SHOP FROM THIS PLACE THEY WILL STEAL YOUR MONEY. GO TO BOBS, THEY HAVE A WHITE GLOVE SET UP AND WILL BRING YOUR FURNITURE IN AND SET IT UP AND IM SURE THEY WONT SEND GHETTO HOODLUMS TO YOUR HOUSE TO LEAVE FURNITURE OUTSIDE FOR YOU TO BRING IN!!!!

user_profile: Bill prefers fresh, high‑quality fare such as Hawaiian poke bowls, well‑executed Asian dishes (e.g., orange chicken, Hunan beef) and upscale American tasting menus, and he enjoys a solid burger when priced fairly. He favors venues that combine a relaxed yet attentive atmosphere—family‑run spots with casual comfort, as well as trendy, classy restaurants that offer outdoor seating or a lively bar setting. Service is a top priority: he expects friendly, prompt staff who honor menu items and respond to his generous tipping with consistent, courteous treatment; lapses like unexpected price hikes or missing menu items quickly turn him away. He values good value for money, willing to spend on tasting menus or generous portions but dislikes being overcharged. Practical conveniences he likes include bike parking, credit‑card acceptance, easy take‑out or delivery, and the ability to make reservations; wheelchair‑accessible and pet‑friendly options are also appreciated. Overall, Bill is generous and enjoys tipping, but he is highly sensitive to service quality and price fairness.

chosen.business_profile: Rooster & the Till is a modern New‑American spot in Tampa, FL that blends upscale‑casual flair with a hip, trendy vibe; the decor is industrial with an open kitchen and the noise level is average, making it suitable for conversations while still lively enough for a night out. The menu leans toward inventive dishes—pasta, foie gras, goat‑based plates and creative small plates—priced in the $$ range (Yelp price level 3), with a well‑stocked wine list and a happy‑hour bar offering reasonably priced wines and cocktails; portions are often modest and some premium items can feel expensive. Service is attentive and owners are hands‑on, though occasional lapses in timing and inconsistency have been reported. Reservations are accepted and recommended, especially for dinner, and the restaurant accommodates larger parties and groups; it also offers take‑out, accepts credit cards, provides a parking lot plus bike‑parking, and is wheelchair accessible, though there is no outdoor seating, delivery, Wi‑Fi, or pet‑friendly options, and it is not geared toward children. Dress code is casual, and a TV is available for background entertainment. Overall the venue offers a classy yet relaxed setting for a date or gathering, with the trade‑off of higher price points and variable service speed.

chosen.review_text: Best restaurant in Tampa Bay.  Had the chef's tasting menu which turned out to be a great value.  Included some of the best dishes I've ever been served in Florida.  My only wish is that the restaurant had full bar.  I knew that going in so not a criticism.  I'd hit this place much more often if they served more than beer and wine.  That being said, food is lights out, service is great (Miles and Lindsay were attentive and charming) and the space is quite nice.  I was in on a Wednesday night and did not see the chef but unlike other restaurants in the Bay Area this place still hits home runs when the "cat" is away.  Everyone in this place does their leader proud.

The menu is limited to lunch and dinner entrées, with modest portion sizes and price points that many find relatively high, and vegan main‑dish options are sparse. Service is table‑side and generally attentive, making the venue well suited for groups, families and kids, especially on Tuesday, Friday and Saturday evenings. Practical conveniences include BYOB with corkage allowed, credit‑card payments, garage, street and valet parking, and reservations are accepted; however there is no delivery, takeout, happy‑hour specials, or live music, and the noise level remains loud.

rejected.review_text: Have had a very good experience here many times...food is good as is service.  I come here for both personal and professional dinners.  When here personally, I always sit at the bar with friends and tip heavy...often 50% or more on the bill regardless of the total.  During the COVID difficulties I frequented the restaurant (mostly for the "Hot Chicken" sandwich.)  Typically we ordered online through the "Toast" app.  I tipped very heavy in this situation as well because I understand how badly the service industry has suffered through COVID.  I came to the restaurant last night for "to go."  You can no longer use "Toast" as the restaurant has contractual problems due to their POS provider.  This was explained to me by the heavily tattooed and glasses wearing manager that I have previously tipped very heavily at the bar.  Maybe I am naive and $50 on a $100 bar tab isn't great (I'm not rich) but who knows?  I was told that I could for this one time place my to go order through the host but anything else needed to go via the On Swann website (how would I know their contractual problems were also mine?)  Additionally, they were making an EXCEPTION for me...also known as a favor.  Forget about the fact they still don't have chicken breasts to make a sandwich.  We ended up with chicken parmesan from Forbici...for eight.  We got EIGHT chicken breasts.  On Swann didn't have chicken for a sandwich last week either.  I don't want to sound like someone that feels the need for special treatment but this manager who I have grossly overtipped more than a dozen times has made it such that I will never return and never recommend On Swann.

chosen.review_text: My wife and I, along with two friends went to Pesto on Saturday, February 3...It's NEVER a mistake having a dinner at Pesto. The staff makes you feel like you're at home, the food is made fresh and has that homemade feel to it, just like your grandmother would make. Being a cook myself, there's not many restaurants I enjoy going to, but Pesto definitely is one of them! Oh and I can't forget, this was the eve of the EAGLES playing in Super Bowl LII, the entire staff was wearing EAGLES gear to show support, the entire restaurant even did the EAGLES fight song! Best restaurant in South Philly! Thanks for a great night Pesto! E-A-G-L-E-S! EAGLES!

rejected.review_text:
I made the mistake of ordering flowers off of the FTD website due to having a recent surgery and not being able to leave my home. The picture on the website (ftd) of the bouquet I ordered was $95 and it was beautiful. The bouquet I received looked like something they picked off the side of the road.  There was more greenery than flowers, there were supposed to be 7 red roses, there was only 3 red roses, the rest of the missing roses were replaced with wilted and broken carnations. 
There was no effort to even make the bouquet look semi presentable. 
I called this florist and they ignorantly told me there's nothing they can do and website photos never look like the actual bouquet. I was then told to take it up with FTD. 
Thankfully after speaking to someone at FTD, they apologized, told me this isn't the first complaint about this florist and that I will be given a full refund.
So two lessons here. 1- don't order flowers from a website. And 2- don't ever get flowers from this particular florist. The flowers sold at red lights before getting on the highway look better than this bouquet.

Amazing shopping experience. One of the best suit selections - no need to go to King of Prussia. More than anything else, I really appreciate the complete service, very personalized attention and guidance from the salespeople. 

I didn't walk out of the store with the item I'm looking to purchase. But, I certainly will be coming back and closing the deal. 

For Men's suits, there's no comparison. Brooks Brothers is fine, but definitely not the same level of customer service and selection as Boyd's.

rejected.business_profile: Lolita in Philadelphia delivers a trendy, casual‑classy Mexican experience with a full bar and happy‑hour specials; the open‑kitchen layout behind the bar creates an energetic vibe, while average noise levels keep conversation comfortable. Seating consists of 22 two‑seat tables that can be combined for groups of up to eight, a ten‑seat bar, and outdoor tables, making it well suited for groups and dinner service. The restaurant accepts credit cards, offers reservations, table service, take‑out and delivery, and provides street parking and bike racks, though it lacks WiFi and does not accommodate dogs or children. With a moderate $$ price range, the menu highlights extensive guacamole, fresh chip selections, a notable watermelon margarita, and flavorful tacos, and it operates a midday closure from 3 pm to 5 pm. Overall, Lolita is a solid adult‑focused spot for Mexican fare in a modern, upbeat setting.

I'll be honest, the quesadilla was amazing. However, it was amazing if all I could stomach was something that fit in the palm of my hand.

The guacamole was served with a great selection of flavorful chips, but the guac itself had little to no flavor. Chipotle has a more tasty guacamole than this. We had to ask for hot sauce to add flavor.

user_profile: Heather is a pragmatic, convenience‑driven diner who values quick, clean, and family‑friendly spots where the service runs smoothly. She gravitates toward casual American comfort foods such as pizza, smoothies, and grocery‑style snacks, favoring places that offer reliable app ordering, drive‑through or take‑out options, and a kid‑welcome atmosphere. Her ideal venues are low‑key, quiet or modestly lively, with casual dress codes and amenities like parking and outdoor seating, but she does not require upscale decor or reservations. She expects prompt, courteous service and spotless environments, and she is sensitive to price, preferring budget‑friendly (price range 1‑2) menus that deliver good value. rejected.review_text: I've been here 3-4x pre-covid and my experience has been pretty good. The food is delicious and it's the one place I can eat anything on the menu, being as I'm a vegetarian. However, I came here last night and I was pretty shocked at how poor the service was. It took our waitress almost 20 minutes to get our drink order, she wasn't able to check on us once during our meal, it took flagging her down after 10 minutes of empty plates for a check, and when we asked for a water bowl for our dog she replied "I'll have to see if I can," and then forgot to bring one. I think this may have just been an issue with this one waitress, because we asked someone else there for a water bowl and he eagerly and promptly was able to help us. The quality of the food was great, just shocked by the poor service. It was not too crowded and there are plenty of heat lamps outside, though it is an open area but we felt pretty warm! Hoping the poor service is a result of covid problems, otherwise it's an excellent restaurant.

Fred Beans Volkswagen in Devon, PA is a full‑service automotive center offering oil changes, repairs, parts, body work and vehicle sales. It accepts credit cards and provides complimentary Wi‑Fi for guests waiting on site. The facility includes waiting‑area parking and standard dealer‑style service desks. While the staff present a friendly appearance, communication gaps are common; customers often report not being notified when service is completed and occasional concerns about the quality of repairs. The dealership’s convenience features are balanced by inconsistent service attentiveness, making it suitable for routine maintenance if prompt updates are not critical.
rejected.review_text: I called sales to test drive the new VW electric car.  No one in sales picked up. I was on hold for 5 minutes plus.

user_profile: Monica prefers flavorful, moderately priced meals that accommodate both vegetarian and classic comfort cuisines, gravitating toward Indian dishes with hearty vegetarian options and Italian fare with a romantic yet approachable vibe. She favors casual‑to‑smart‑casual settings that are family‑friendly, offer easy parking (especially bike parking), outdoor seating, and reliable Wi‑Fi, and she often uses delivery or takeout when available. Good, courteous service and a clean, well‑maintained environment are important to her, as she values professionalism and will avoid places that seem deceptive or poorly managed. She tends to choose restaurants with a price range around the mid‑level, appreciates reservations for dinner outings, and enjoys venues that are suitable for groups or kids. Overall, Monica is discerning yet appreciative of businesses that deliver consistent quality and value.

chosen.business_profile: Empower Adventures in Oldsmar, FL offers ziplining and team‑building experiences designed for families, couples, and groups, with a strong emphasis on safety and organization. Guests can book appointments and enjoy guided tours lasting about two hours that include up to five fast, tall zip lines, water provided on the course, and photo stops. The facility is wheelchair accessible, provides bike parking, accepts credit cards, and offers a free lot for car parking, though street and garage options are unavailable. Kids are welcomed and activities are tailored to be kid‑friendly, while the staff are described as attentive and knowledgeable, ensuring comfort and fun throughout the experience. The appointment‑only model may limit spontaneous visits, and parking is limited to a lot, but overall the venue delivers a well‑structured, family‑oriented adventure.

chosen.review_text: Really great time!  We went as a family to celebrate my husband's birthday and had a blast.  Calvin and Johnny were fantastic.  We'll be back!

rejected.business_profile: Powerhouse Gym Athletic Club in Tampa, FL offers a comprehensive fitness experience, combining a fully equipped weight‑lifting and cardio area, group boot‑camp classes, personal‑training services and an on‑site nutrition shop that serves protein shakes and healthy bowls. The center is wheelchair accessible, provides bike parking and a free surface lot for vehicles, and accepts credit cards. Families and children are welcome. The location is situated away from major interstates and downtown business districts, which can add extra travel time for commuters. Noise levels may rise during the popular D1 training sessions, making the gym louder than usual. Staff are experienced, many having transferred from the former Downtown Tampa Powerhouse location, and the nutrition offerings are competitively priced. Overall, the facility is best suited for guests seeking extensive equipment and wellness services, while tolerating a less convenient address and occasional high‑volume workout periods.

user_profile: Manny is a laid‑back, friendly eater who gravitates toward hearty, comfort‑style dishes and bright, tropical or Asian flavors, often enjoying breakfast classics, Vietnamese fare, and Hawaiian‑inspired plates. He prefers casual, family‑friendly spots that are quietly lively, with a relaxed vibe, free Wi‑Fi, and easy parking; kid‑friendliness and wheelchair accessibility are pluses, and he values establishments that offer takeout, delivery, or quick service without the need for formal reservations. Good, welcoming service—like a warm greeting from the owner—and transparent, reasonable pricing (typically budget‑to‑mid range) are important to him, while hidden fees or unexpected add‑ons quickly turn him off. Overall, Manny leans toward affordable, well‑served venues that combine tasty, familiar comfort food with a convenient, low‑stress dining experience.

chosen.business_profile: Aloha To Go is a casual, budget‑friendly food‑truck‑style eatery in Indian Shores, FL that blends Hawaiian flavors with cheesesteaks, barbecue and seafood. The venue is quiet and geared toward families, offering ample seating for kids and a menu that delivers generous, flavorful portions for lunch and dinner. No alcohol is served, but free Wi‑Fi, bike parking, a public parking lot and wheelchair access add convenience, while credit‑card payment and delivery are accepted. The dress code is casual, there is no outdoor seating, reservations are not taken, and group seating is limited; however, the spot is suited for quick, take‑away style meals and offers catering for larger events.

Place is very cool , the owner Jen greeted us and made us feel very welcome. I had the Big Kahuna plate and it's awesome. My friend had the Chicken Katsu plate and wow it's Killer. Spam masubi was delish 
I've lived in Hawaii for many years and enjoy the local food scene . This is all about aloha spirit ,great  food and good time . I will be back sooner than later

rejected.review_text: One star is too many. Came in for 4 tires at the advertised price . After speaking to the sales rep he I formed me that the out the door price was $639.00 for tires where in sale for $54 a piece . I told him I did not want tire protection , I dint need an alignment or road hazard. He said that at that price it was It was only with the add ons. What a rip off . Firestone will not ever see a penny from any of my coworkers. So near the airport and we alway give them business .

user_profile: Kendra is a pragmatic, friendly‑minded diner who values convenience, swift service and a relaxed environment where she can work or catch up with friends. She gravitates toward casual breakfast‑and‑brunch spots and coffee‑centric eateries offering Mediterranean‑style or classic American comfort fare, with an emphasis on good coffee and light, tasty food. She prefers quiet, dog‑friendly venues with free Wi‑Fi, outdoor seating and a laid‑back vibe rather than loud, upscale settings, and she often chooses places that provide bike parking and accept credit cards. Service expectations are high on friendliness and speed—she appreciates staff who are attentive, helpful and keep wait times short. Her spending habit leans toward budget‑friendly to mid‑range options that deliver solid value, and she likes the flexibility of take‑out and occasional reservations when needed. Overall, Kendra is easygoing and forgiving, rewarding establishments that meet her practical needs for comfort, convenience and a pleasant, unpretentious atmosphere.

user_profile: Tony enjoys laid‑back, community‑oriented dining where the atmosphere is casual yet a bit polished, often with outdoor seating, bike parking and a dog‑friendly vibe. He favors American comfort foods such as hearty breakfasts with homemade pancakes, brunch staples, and well‑topped pizzas made with organic, local ingredients, as well as quality seafood and specialty meats like salmon and rabbit. He looks for venues that offer a broad, varied menu and quick, attentive service; slow or overly limited menus feel disappointing to him. His price comfort sits in the moderate range, seeking good value rather than upscale luxury, and he appreciates practical amenities like free WiFi, credit‑card acceptance, take‑out options and the ability to accommodate families or kids. Overall, Tony is friendly‑minded and forgiving but will avoid places that feel overrated, have scarce menu choices, or provide sluggish service.

chosen.business_profile: Pizza Guru in Santa Barbara offers casual pizza and broader Italian‑style fare with a sizable menu that includes vegan, pescatarian and other specialty options; it is moderately priced (price range 2) and serves lunch and dinner, making it suitable for families, groups and happy‑hour gatherings. The venue has a relaxed, average‑noise atmosphere, free Wi‑Fi, beer‑and‑wine service, a TV, outdoor seating, bike parking and a nearby lot, and it is wheelchair accessible and credit‑card friendly. Service is counter‑style with no reservations, and both takeout and delivery are available, though delivery may run longer than anticipated. Overall, Pizza Guru provides a convenient, value‑oriented option for a laid‑back pizza meal.

This place is totally over rated. The food they serve is good enough,but their menu is extremely limited. We went for Easter Sunday brunch. They had only one or two egg dishes on the menu. No omelettes at all. The wait staff was slow at best but not terrible. 

If your looking for a good brunch with a selection of food. I'd look elsewhere. At least check out the menu before you make reservations.

user_profile: Pete is a discerning diner who enjoys well‑executed, upscale comfort food and isn’t afraid to plan ahead for a memorable meal. He favors American‑style burgers with gourmet touches and Italian‑inspired dishes such as risotto or mushroom‑laden entrees, while avoiding inconsistent, mass‑produced pasta. He prefers venues that offer a classy yet relaxed atmosphere – romantic, intimate settings with outdoor seating, a good wine list, and a lively but not noisy background – and values attentive, polished service that goes the extra mile. Mid‑range prices (around $‑$$) are acceptable as long as the quality justifies the cost, and he often books reservations well in advance for popular spots. Practical amenities he looks for include bike parking, easy outdoor access, and pet‑friendly options when available; he is forgiving of higher wine prices but critical of bland food or poor consistency.

chosen.business_profile: Toma Restaurant & Bar in Santa Barbara blends New American and Italian cuisine with a full bar, offering a classy yet casually attired setting that caters well to families and solo diners; the menu delivers well‑executed, mainstream dishes such as shrimp gncchi and fried olives, while the average noise level and outdoor seating make for a comfortable dinner experience. Price points sit in the mid‑range (price level 3) and reservations are accepted; the venue provides table service, a happy‑hour menu, and takes both takeout and corkage, though it does not offer delivery or BYOB. Parking is available on the street and in a lot, with bike parking also provided, and the restaurant is wheelchair accessible; however, it lacks Wi‑Fi, does not accommodate large groups, and has no valet service. The full bar serves beer, wine, and spirits, and the establishment is smoke‑free, making it a solid choice for a relaxed, family‑friendly evening, especially on Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday evenings.

Owner spent a year in Italy. It shows.

rejected.review_text: Stunned we are by all the five star reviews! Relatives? Friends? Who knows. The pasta is routine beyond belief, the inconsistency startling (sometimes it's al dent, sometimes it's Olive Garden mush). In a city with so many competitive dining options including the amazing nearby Pascucci and Persona wood fired pizza, it is indeed a wonder that this place survives. If you're hankering for Italian food you have many superior options.

user_profile: Andy is a detail‑oriented, no‑nonsense diner who values honesty, transparent pricing, and efficient service over flashiness. He gravitates toward straightforward fare such as classic American comfort food, hearty burgers, well‑executed pizzas, and simple, reliably prepared dishes rather than experimental or overly intricate cuisines. His ideal eateries are casual, low‑key spots with a relaxed, family‑friendly vibe—think neighborhood diners or modest taverns rather than upscale or themed venues. He expects clear menu pricing, no surprise add‑ons, prompt attention from knowledgeable staff, and a clean, well‑maintained setting, and he is quick to spot and call out any perceived overcharging or sloppy service. Andy prefers budget‑friendly to moderate price points that deliver solid value, and he appreciates practical conveniences like easy parking, straightforward take‑out or delivery options, and the ability to walk in without a reservation. Overall, he is a tough critic who rewards businesses that are forthright, competent, and give good bang‑for‑buck, while being unforgiving of hidden fees or subpar professionalism.

chosen.business_profile: Quality Small Dent Repair in Reno, NV is a family‑run automotive body shop specializing in dent removal and minor collision repair. The shop is known for responsive, personalized service—owners and staff answer inquiries quickly, schedule same‑day appointments, and often adjust pricing downward from the original estimate. Payment can be made with credit cards, and the location offers paid WiFi for customers awaiting service. The business is praised for flexibility with scheduling, especially in adverse weather, and for working with insurance copays. It provides a convenient, no‑frills environment suited to drivers needing efficient, trustworthy repairs; however, amenities are limited to basic waiting facilities without dining options.

rejected.review_text:
RIP OFF HVAC Service, do not use them, they try to upsell you and price gouge hoping you will pay a premium for their service. They also won't send you an invoice with a parts and labor breakdown which is pretty standard in the industry, which points to them trying to pad their fees. They also will try to take advantage of you if you are female, as they assume if you are a woman you are not mechanically inclined and try to take advantage of that.

Hello all. I am by no way an HVAC technician, however I have been a machinist, welder, and mechanic most of my life, so I have a little bit of all experience.

Our furnace stopped producing heat, and I decided I didn't need to deal with it so my wife gave All Hours a call, and they sent a tech out to give an "estimate". My wife was the only one home with our new baby, and I was at work, so I told her to to just get the bid. Our furnace is older anyways so I decided to see what it would cost to replace our new unit.

The technician that came out quoted us $1,200 to replace the draft inducer in the burner, saying that the furnace was 11 years old and it was not recommended anyways to repair it and agreed with me to replace it. He also said it was nearly impossible to find parts for this furnace cause it was an "off brand". Caveat; I have never worked on furnaces so I believed him and asked him to quote replacing our furnace for a 96% 60,000 BTU furnace which was the correct calculation for the house. The technician started arguing with me saying that they we needed to get the furnace through them as they had all the parts. OK fair enough, waited to get their estimate.

On the LOW END, they wanted to charge $6,000 to replace our furnace with a new one, and $24,000 to a full furnace swap and install a heat pump.

On further research, a Goodman 96% efficient 60K BTU propane furnace is $1,200 with free shipping to our door. Even when I inquired about paying for the labor I was told it would still be over $6,000 and they kept dodging my questions about how many hours it would take and what their hourly labor rate was. Every contractor I have worked with across multiple industries ALWAYS gives me their labor rate and a job estimate for billable hours. This is when I started to expect they were not being truthful and trying to pad their pockets with extra money.

My dad drove up the same day to help me look at our furnace, and noticed the draft inducer was unplugged when we popped the access panel and plugged it back in, the motor got hot instantly. Four bolts and a screw later we had the draft inducer out and noticed the bearings had failed and seized up.

Ten minutes on Google and $113 with free shipping later, my new draft inducer arrived, I installed it in ten minutes, and the burners kicked on again, and my furnace is working fine. Looking into the average HVAC rate, a contractor should charge between $150-$250 per hour, and replacing an entire furnace with the gas already run is at maximum a 4 hour job with a tech who knows what they are doing.

I can't believe this *company* was trying to charge me $1,200 for ten minutes worth of work to replace a glorified 120 V motor. What happened to honesty in the business?

People, do your own research and do not get ripped off by unscrupulous contractors such as these. They are hoping you are not smart enough to ask the right questions such as (how long the job takes/billable hours/parts). There seems to me a lot of these outfits in Reno so please do your own research to not get ripped off by shoddy companies. Just read the other reviews on here..... the average cost for a brand new hvac with centra install from a reputable contractor is around $3,500-$4,000 including parts.

-Andy

Edit: see the below response from the owner personally attacking me telling me I "don't know what it takes to run a business".  Exactly the kind of professionalism you don't want in your life. He didn't address my factual research about what things should cost like I don't understand profit margins etc.

rejected.review_text: I gave a urine sample on a Tuesday for a possible UTI.  The results were not at my doctor's by Friday afternoon!  He gave me a broad spectrum antibiotic for the weekend that barely helped but it was a miserable weekend!  On Monday, when they finally got the results, my doctor was able to prescribe the exact antibiotic I needed which started working quite quickly!  Thanks Labcorp for your prompt results!  (NOT!)  ( I mentioned this incident to a Quest employee later when I was in there for a blood sample and she said that the same thing had happened to someone she knew and they ended up having to go to the hospital to have treatment when the results from her urine sample did not come back in a timely manner) WOW! NEVER GOING TO LABCORP AGAIN!

chosen.review_text: Decided to take the family out for dinner here one Saturday evening.  Possibly not the best night to try out a new place for us.  Our server took FOREVER to take our order.  When we did order, the food came at various intervals.  While everyone was eating the sushi, my wife and I were still waiting another 15 minutes for our entrees.  They also forgot my salad.  By the time our entrees came, everyone was done eating their sushi.  I ordered the Teriyaki beef.  For 19 dollars, I expected some tender thinly shaved slices of beef in some kind of new wave asian style preparation.  Instead, I got a tough piece of sirloin that had some sauce on it.  Not good.  Very stringy and very tough piece of meat.  The kids thought sushi was better other places...but passable.  So, I'll give this place 3 stars.

Wow!  This place just can't get to last place fast enough.  A few years back, they were a good pizza.  I've noted it going downhill over the years.  Haven't ordered from them in a while, and this is the last time I'll patronize the place.  Whew!  You will pay $35 for two pizzas that have frozen dough, skimpy toppings, and the worst customer service you ever called.  

You try and grab a slice from the box and the piece tears...like frozen pizza you cook in your oven.  Almost every piece was like this.  Just incredible. If you order a cheese pizza, you better be prepared for the sorriest cheese pizza you ever saw.  Think of NY style with no cheese.  I'm done with Greeks.  I think the Covid crisis has done them in.  They might as well close up serving garbage like this.  Do yourself a favor and get a better tasting frozen French bread pizza from Walmart.

It is a smoke‑free, dog‑free setting with casual attire, no Wi‑Fi, and a generally classy yet relaxed vibe; expect a bustling atmosphere that can feel chilly near the entry and a high noise level typical of a busy bar.
chosen.text:
Alexandra enjoys social dining experiences where attentive, knowledgeable staff make the visit smooth, and she quickly loses interest when service is slow or staff seem clueless; she gravitates toward seafood and wine‑focused menus, American‑style bars and casual restaurants that serve fresh fish, lobster, and a solid full‑bar selection, while a competent pizza joint can also appeal. Her ideal ambience is lively yet relaxed—a casual, trendy or modestly upscale setting that accommodates groups, offers private rooms, and provides a comfortable bar atmosphere, often with background music or chatter rather than overly quiet tones. She expects prompt ordering, clear payment options (credit cards accepted), and the ability to reserve or walk‑in without long waits; take‑out and delivery are convenient but not essential. Price‑wise she prefers mid‑range establishments that deliver good value without overcharging. Overall, Alexandra is a discerning diner who rewards excellent service and quality food while being quick to criticize venues with poor customer service, slow service, or indifferent staff.

It is a smoke‑free, dog‑free setting with casual attire, no Wi‑Fi, and a generally classy yet relaxed vibe; expect a bustling atmosphere that can feel chilly near the entry and a high noise level typical of a busy bar.
chosen.review_text: My boyfriend and I went to lure for new years, and then happy hour for New Year's Day, and then my birthday! Haha three times in a week and we couldn't get enough. When we got there, despite how packed it was, we got a seat right at the bar and were amazed at the attentiveness of the staff. Then we sampled some wines and ordered a bottle, amazing selection! The appetizers blew up away, and so did the entree. I recommend the lobster! Amazing prices and amazing service. We are so glad they opened and this is our new favorite spot!!! Thank you lure (and josh!) for making our experiences fabulous. Lastly, I thought it was great that we could book a private room for my birthday and connect our phones for our own music! What a cool feature!!

rejected.review_text: Seriously hate this place now.  My friend ordered wine which took TWENTY minutes before she asked about where it was.  She then was done and ready to leave and asked for a refund. They said they couldn't given a refund because they didn't know how. Wtf? So she asked for credit-they didn't know how to transfer credit to a gift card: wtf again? So we asked for a manager who wasn't working. So she reluctantly took a glass of wine.  Then I ask for ranch- 50 cents. Try to put it on a card because who has cash these days? Nope-needs to be cash.  Second bad experience in the last six months at this place.  I would pick BARBaRIANS any day. Screw this place and their shitty ass customer service and lack of knowledge.

chosen.review_text: As others have said this is a true gem at Christiana Mall.   A limited menu but what they have they do very well.   I prefer this over a sprawling menu where everything is mediocre.  Best burger at the mall hands down.  French dip is tender, very flavorful, and the roll is just right.   I have been there once for lunch and it's head and shoulders above the other chain restaurants.  Wait staff was very professional and courteous.   And whomever runs the kitchen knows exactly what they are doing.  It's like a mini Harry's Savoy Grill.  Will be going back very soon.....

rejected.review_text: I transferred my prescriptions here from Walgreens because this CVS had better hours and my insurance is part of the same company.  I REGRET this now because they are absolutely terrible.  I had my doctor prescribe a new medicine (very widely available, not a specialty) and two plus days later (weekdays mind you) it still says processing and nothing changes.   I try calling and have waited over 45 minutes on the phone only to have NOBODY answer.   So my health suffers because of their inability to process a prescription.  Do I go there and just wait in line to be told to come back later?  Talk about wasting my time.  I complained to corporate and got a nice form letter response that they thank me for my concern.  STAY AWAY!!!

rejected.review_text:
Babalu has been around for a LONG time... We were just there recently and you can really see the age in the building, the furniture, how many layers of paint are on the wall and all the power cords that line the ceiling.  The more I looked around the more I noticed how much the building needs to updated and cleaned!! I wouldn't be surprised if they showed up in the Dirty Dining list. I cannot imagine when the kitchen looks like....    

I asked about a few of the menu items before I ordered and the server was kind enough to tell me each was frozen, "from a box".  My MIL ordered Boneless chicken and she said she was positive it was frozen Tyson Chicken   because it tastes exactly like what she buys at home.  The "from the owner" section on Yelp states that say "delicious homemade food" which is not completely true.  ASK before you order. 

The server can't remember what food was ordered by whom and never refilled any of our drinks.  Our table was getting up to leave and instead of being polite to the customers and saying "Excuse me" because he needed to pass and we didn't realize he was there he just pushed through and rudely barked "Coming through!". There are so many restaurants in the area that I will not go back to Babalu's.

Midas in King of Prussia, PA, is a full‑service automotive center offering tire sales, oil changes, general auto repair, and other vehicle maintenance; credit cards are accepted for payment. The facility provides ample on‑site parking and a straightforward, walk‑in service model with no reservation or dining‑related amenities. Service efficiency is balanced by reports of curt phone interactions and a sales approach that can emphasize additional, higher‑priced repairs, which may affect perceived value for cost‑conscious customers. Advantages include the convenience of multiple automotive services under one roof and accepted credit card payments; potential drawbacks are occasional impersonal customer service and aggressive upselling tendencies.
chosen.review_text: These guys are legit. I'm a repeat customer and have been for years thanks to their quality of work, experience, and award winning staff. Like a dentist, they give it to you straight when something needs attention. Avoid it, and in the long run you will pay a much greater price. The preventive maintenance schedule I'm now on thanks to Midas King of Prussia costs me much less than the repairs I've had to make in the past. Doing the standard oil change, rotation, and few other things just to keep your vehicle on the road and pass inspection simply doesn't cut it. They keep my SUV in such great overall condition, I expect the only long-term issue will be car frame rust...

rejected.review_text:
Update:  Milestone has still not called or returned my voicemails about the damage they caused during my move.  If you want to have your stuff ruined, please feel free to use there services! A smarter investment would be to rent a truck and hire kids.  They are a joke.  Please save your money, time, and lots of frustration and look elsewhere.  This company is a joke and should be shut down.

Posted on 8/25:
Do not use this moving service!  They are rookies in the moving game and do not do any of the services they claim.  The movers they sent me were terrible.  They immediately got their rental truck stuck in my yard and then they began loading without using any sort of protective moving materials.  From there the rest is downhill....

They ripped couches jamming them through doorways and they also sweat all over our items since they didn't use any sort of protective material while moving.  I would look anywhere else and pay a bit more since this is a waste of money for the service you receive.  They are con artists who leverage a bait and switch technique to make your feel comfortable and then your movers show up and you realize you got what you paid for.  

After they ripped our largest couch the movers denied it and the company still has not followed up with my about reimbursement.  Look elsewhere!

rejected.review_text: I personally didn't have the best customer service experience. We got there someone sat us down, but after that our waitress came to get our orders and that's it. She didn't bring us any napkins, or utensils to eat with. Don't get me wrong tho it was dryer than, I could literally count on one hand how many people were there. I also hate the fact that they put straws on the drink for us, like I don't know where your hands have been. But the lobster roll was cold and nasty to me, so was crab cake sandwich but the crab Mac and cheese and their crab fries was really good.

chosen.review_text:
Reilly is a wonderful hot spot with some excellent pizzas, a nice craft cocktail selection and talented mixologists behind the bar, and a well curated beer and wine selection.  I've been there twice now while in town visiting with my UA daughter and have sampled several of the pizzas.  

Thus far, I have had the following from their list: 
-margherita
-fennel sausage & roasted peppers
-pepperoni & pickled fresno chile
-yukon gold potato & pecorino
-vegan
-meatball & ricotta 

Truly full flavor in all the pizzas I've tried that can only mean fresh ingredients, and nice crust that can only mean hand tossed dough.  The atmosphere is fun and lively and service has been attentive on each visit, both at the bar and tables.  If you like good pizza, refreshing drink and a  vibrant scene in which to enjoy it, don't miss Reilly!

rejected.review_text:
Unfortunately, La Paloma is hit or miss these days.   The grounds are certainly expansive and beautiful.  The golf is great, and the dining is excellent.   Contigo Latin Kitchen, on property, is a fantastic dining experience with top notch f&b, a great bar and beautiful patio.  Whether you're staying at the resort or not, Contigo is worth experiencing.   

That said, the rooms...well you just can't be sure what you're getting with the rooms, and that's the reason for my 3 star review.   The golf course, mountain and sunset views from rooms on the westerly facing side of the property are stunning.  The east side, not so much.   The furniture in many of the rooms is dated, the AC has an impossible time keeping up with the summer heat and, if you're in an 2nd level room on the west side, hope the elevator is working.  I recently stayed at the property for an entire week and the one elevator accessing our room was inop the entire time.  Had to have maintenance come to our suite several times in one visit this past summer to repair the AC because while there were other rooms available they would have all been a downgrade.

They need to invest some money into the rooms and infrastructure.

chosen.review_text:
For New Orleans, just off of Bourbon, and for the price, YES this is as good as it gets! Absolutely loved this place. The rooms are amazing. Try to stay in the garden wing of the hotel. You will have a back door that opens to a courtyard. 
It was so wonderful to be able to stay here and all for the price of a hotel you'd find at the airport. It was really nice being off the strip and in the comfy sheets at this hotel!

Will definitely be staying here again!

This is the super popular place to get po boys apparently. It was recommended by the horse buggie people as were rode by on our tour. They have tons of variety. 
 That said, I wasn't impressed. Either the shrimp or the oil it was cooked in had gone rancid and that just turned me off immediately. They are over priced and come with nothing. There are so many other places in the french quarter that are off the grid and sooooo much better!!!

She gravitates toward casual diners and cafés that serve hearty, familiar dishes like pancakes, eggs, and sandwiches, and appreciates easy ordering options such as credit‑card payment, free Wi‑Fi, and ample parking (including bike racks). A clean, well‑maintained environment and prompt, courteous service are essential; she is quick to note unfriendly or sarcastic staff and expects errors to be handled politely and efficiently. Her spending habits favor budget‑friendly pricing with good portion sizes, and she often looks for take‑out or flexible seating rather than upscale ambience. Overall, Ashley is forgiving when staff are professional but is not tolerant of rude attitudes or unnecessary delays.

chosen.review_text: From the moment I called to get a quote for my remote start the customer service was TOP TIER. Explained everything I needed to know. Bf just set up for audio and remote start as well. TAKE YOUR CAR NOWWWWW!

rejected.review_text: I never rent at this location, but I had the "pleasure" of dealing with this office because my mother's insurance provided her a car through here. On an early Saturday morning, my mother and I pull off to begin some errands the vehicle begins to make a rattling noise. We pull over get out and it sounds like someone is playing the Drumline soundtrack underneath the hood. At 11:46 I tell my mom, we need to take this vehicle back and get it switched. Now of course this location is closing at 12. We call just to see if the switch can take place at another location. *insert image of my rubbing my temples and nothing is improving* I speak with who will be an unnamed gentleman (after all this yelp is meant to vent not attack or put anyone on blast), and express the issue to him. He stated we have no cars here and we will need to call Cherry Hill. WE? As in me? Bitch I know you lying. If you don't call that other branch to confirm they have something cuz their vehicle sound like it's on the highway to the Upper Room. I gathered the impression that when it was my mother speaking he felt he could dismiss her in an effort to hang up and meet his 12p clock out time. Once I got on the phone with some base and "I wish tf you would", the tone changed. After being placed on hold, big surprise, cherry hill doesn't have any cars. I say, "well I guess it's a good thing we didn't drive straight there, huh? I'll wait while you check other branches. Thank you." Long story short we are finally told to go to the Burlington location where they were more than accommodating (good review to follow). I thanked him and asked the address of the office. He says, oh you just google enterprise Burlington........wow. Just wow.

user_profile: Kristen is an enthusiastic, food‑driven diner who enjoys discovering spots with hearty, well‑executed dishes and friendly, attentive service. She gravitates toward American comfort fare such as big breakfast omelets, brunch buffets, burgers and casual family‑style meals, as well as Italian pasta and pizza and Asian‑inspired noodle bowls. Her preferred ambience is casual to upbeat – lively, eclectic or trendy spaces that feel welcoming and are comfortable for groups, yet she also appreciates straightforward, family‑friendly settings. Service speed and attentiveness matter to her; she values quick greetings, water refills and prompt drink service, and is impatient with long waits or understaffed venues. She favors mid‑range pricing that offers generous portions and good value, and is comfortable with modest budgets when the food is excellent. Practical preferences include ample parking (lot or bike parking), the option to reserve a table during busy times, and take‑out or delivery when available; she notes cash‑only policies and appreciates establishments that clearly communicate such requirements. Overall, Kristen is a relatively exacting yet appreciative diner who rewards places that combine tasty, plentiful food with friendly, efficient service.

chosen.business_profile: Tried & True Alehouse is a casual gastropub in Greenwood, IN serving American traditional and new‑style pub cuisine with an emphasis on bar fare such as chicken wings and pimento cheese, complemented by a full bar, cocktail options, and a sports‑bar vibe; the venue is loud, has free Wi‑Fi, outdoor seating, and a TV, making it suitable for groups, families, and kids. It offers moderate‑priced meals (price range 2) for lunch and dinner, with table service, takeout, delivery, and catering available, but no reservations. Practical conveniences include a parking lot, bike parking, credit‑card acceptance, wheelchair accessibility, and a casual dress code, while smoking is prohibited and pets are not allowed. The menu is relatively limited, especially for vegetarians or health‑focused diners, and some dishes have been described as bland or inconsistently prepared, which may affect overall satisfaction.

rejected.review_text: The food was decent... for my first Noodle bar experience. I had the Beef Ball/Steak Pho and I added fried rice... the Rice was great!!! The reason for the 3 stars... they are VERY understaffed and waited a lot longer than we should have for mediocre food. They didn't refill our waters, drinks are in cans or bottles. There is a full bar but it took over 30 mins for a margarita...

rejected.review_text: We got here a bit early and was told we wouldn't be able to check in until after 12, no problem. So we went to lunch and came back around noon. We were told no rooms yet. So we sat down to wait with me checking with them every so often. After about 8 couples checked in I went to the desk to find out what was going on. The other woman checked us in with 5 options of rooms. I was beyond pissed at this point. Needless to say I won't be back to this Hilton property again. The other women didn't even apologize or try to say anything to us. She kept her head down the entire time. No such thing as good customer service any more.

user_profile: Elisa is a pragmatic, efficiency‑focused diner who prefers casual, quick‑service venues and becomes quickly frustrated by long waits, understaffing, or order errors. She favors straightforward, low‑key settings that offer convenient take‑out, drive‑through or outdoor seating, free Wi‑Fi, and easy parking or bike‑friendly access. While price‑sensitive and comfortable with budget‑friendly options, she expects reliable, prompt service and will avoid places where delays or mistakes outweigh low cost. Overall, Elisa is relatively exacting and not very forgiving of service lapses.
